Title
: Account Manager - Lumber Industry


Reports to
: Branch Manager





Position Summary:


The Account Manager is responsible for acting as the primary contact for Builders, Renovators and Homeowners engaging in a construction project. The Account Manager is responsible for quoting all key product categories (Lumber, Trusses, EWP, Windows, Trim & Doors, Drywall & Insulation, Siding, and roofing) for their accounts, and completing administrative tasks (CRM, Forecasting, Accounts Receivable, Monthly Reporting).





Compensation Package:


$1,000 Signing Bonus and $500 COVID Vaccination Bonus

Base Salary: $40,000 - $52,000

Commission: 1% of gross margin dollars – paid quarterly.

Total Commission Range: $2,500 - $10,000

Bonus Opportunity: $0 - $1,000

Total Compensation Package: $43,500 - $63,000

Benefits – Available after successful completion of probationary period.

D.P.S.P. – Deferred profit-sharing program





Major Duties and Responsibilities:



Living the Turkstra Values:


 • Provide world-class customer service and quality building products.

 • Provide a safe and healthy work environment for all.

 • Act with integrity in all our dealings with customers and suppliers.





Customer Service:


 • Follows Turkstra's approach to world class customer service.

 • Advises customers by providing proficient knowledge of products and services; using resources where required.

 • Assists customers in making the best selections for their specified project.

Construction Material Quoting and Estimating:

 • Analyzes blue prints and preliminary drawings.

 • Completes quantity take-offs for all products required including lumber, windows, Trim, and Doors, Siding, Drywall & Insulation etc.





Customer Relationship Management


 • Focus on growing customer relationships, share of wallet and customer intimacy





Manage Pricing and Competitive Situations






Work together with the Branch and Sales Teams to achieve business objectives






Commitment to ongoing professional development






Qualifications
:


Education/Experience Requirements:


 • Completion of Secondary School.

 • Completion of a three-year College program in civil or construction engineering technology; or several years’ experience as a qualified tradesperson in a construction trade such as carpentry or plumbing.

 • Ability to read blueprints.

 • Experience of construction industry is an asset.

 • Basic building code and residential framing knowledge





Abilities/Skill Requirements:


 • Customer focused.

 • Communication skills, both written and verbal.

 • Detail oriented.

 • General Math Skills.

 • Ability to work in a fast-paced environment

 • Strong time management skills.





COVID-19 considerations:


As a condition of employment, all staff are required to provide proof that they are fully vaccinated or provide proof of valid exemption satisfactory to the employer prior to the start date.

job_title: Concepteur d’architecture de cybersécurité - les solutions pré-vente
description:
526734BR


Introduction


Chez IBM, les concepteurs d'architecture de solutions travaillent à comprendre les besoins puis à créer des solutions complexes et de haute qualité qui ont des répercussions importantes. Vous serez responsable de la direction générale et de la prestation des solutions, du besoin e la mise en œuvre. Vous utiliserez vos connaissances approfondies des produits et des technologies de pointe ainsi que vos compétences en matière industrielles et commerciales pour influencer les résultats.

Votre rôle et vos responsabilités

En tant que concepteur d’architecture de sécurité d’IBM, vous assumez l’ensemble du leadership technique et des responsabilités lié à l’exécution des tâches suivantes : concevoir des solutions qui tirent profit des capacités du portefeuille de Sécurité IBM et génèrent des revenus liés aux ventes de logiciels et de logiciels sous forme de services. Les concepteurs exercent des fonctions de direction des activités techniques pendant le cycle de ventes, définissent une vision pour les clients, dirigent la collecte des exigences et l’analyse, conçoivent des solutions, animent les démonstrations et présentations et font partie intégrante d’une équipe des ventes axée sur le succès des clients.

Il s’agit d’un poste de haute direction en matière de ventes techniques. Il s’agit de fonctions où le titulaire est en contact avec la clientèle. Le candidat doit donc posséder le niveau de confiance et d’aisance qu’il faut pour travailler avec des cadres de secteur d’activité et collaborer efficacement avec les équipes des ventes et les partenaires commerciaux IBM.


Compétences Recherchées


Méthodologies et outils de conception d’architecture - capacité de faire appel aux notions de conception d’architecture et une certaine connaissance des méthodes et outils utilisés en conception de solution, évaluation du risque, etc.

Principes de gestion de la sécurité informatique – Très bonne compréhension des technologies de cybersécurité et expérience du développement de l’architecture de cybersécurité pour des clients de différents secteurs. Compréhension fondamentale des principes de gestion de la sécurité informatique, bonne compréhension de la résolution d’incidents informatiques, de la reprise après sinistre, du contrôle d’accès, de l’authentification, de l’audit, de la gouvernance, de la gestion du risque, de l’architecture de sécurité, de la cryptographie, du développement des systèmes et de la continuité des opérations.

Systèmes de TI - compréhension fondamentale des systèmes et des services de TI, ce qui comprend la virtualisation, les grands systèmes, les services infonuagiques, les services d’hébergement, les ordinateurs de bureau, etc.

Développement des systèmes - Compréhension fondamentale du développement

des systèmes de TI.

Technologies réseautiques - Compréhension des notions fondamentales des technologies réseautiques des TI, des constituants de base qui sont utilisés et de leur manière de favoriser la sécurité de l’architecture.

Autres compétences recherchées : Capacité de présenter le matériel et d’assurer le dialogue entre les cadres et le personnel technique; expérience de l’élaboration de soumissions, de présentations techniques, et de diagrammes d’architecture; expérience des tâches de soutien/conseils aux ventes et de vente de solutions; capacité de diriger une équipe.

Emplacement


Principales Responsabilités




 Promouvoir la valeur d’IBM par des discussions et ateliers en matière d’architecture.

 Mener des évaluations de la valeur en matière de sécurité, préparer des rapports et présenter leurs conclusions et recommandations.

 Définir la stratégie technique relative à des occasions commerciales.

 Diriger la collecte et l’analyse des exigences.

 Concevoir des solutions de sécurité en faisant appel aux capacités de Sécurité IBM.

 Donner des présentations à l’intention de clients et participer à des discussions de tableau blanc.

 Faire partie intégrante d’une équipe des ventes.

 Être responsable d’importantes relations de direction.

 Favoriser le succès des clients en matière de sécurité.



Les candidats retenus pour un poste à Montréal, QC, doivent être parfaitement bilingues en anglais et en français.

IBMReferred_NorthAmerica

Expertise professionnelle et technique requise



Le candidat doit être bilingue (anglais et français).

La désignation CISSP ou la désignation de sécurité sont d’importants atouts.

La compréhension des technologies IBM est un atout.

Haut niveau de compétence technique.

Capacité de bien travailler en équipe.

Goût de la résolution de problèmes et des solutions d’architecture.

Leader ayant d’excellentes habiletés en matière de présentation.



Expertise professionnelle et technique privilégié

Doit avoir la capacité de travailler au Canada sans parrainage.

A propos de l'unité commerciale

Alimentée par les technologies cognitives, plus de 150 offres SaaS, et des aperçus en temps réel, l'équipe des marchés mondiaux offre une expertise intégrée afin d'aider nos clients à prendre de meilleures décisions et à innover tout en collaborant avec leurs clients, partenaires et fournisseurs. Rejoignez-nous afin de continuer à stimuler l'innovation avec le portefeuille le plus complet pour les entreprises de tous les secteurs d'activité.

Votre vie chez IBM

Envie d'en savoir plus? Prêt à résoudre certains des défis parmi les plus uniques au monde? Et prêt à façonner l'avenir de millions de personnes?

Si c'est le cas, il est alors temps de vous joindre à nous, d'exprimer votre individualité, de laisser le champ libre à votre curiosité et d'explorer de nouvelles possibilités.

Chaque IBMiste (ou IBMiste potentiel comme vous) dispose d'une voix, trace son propre chemin et propose son expertise en vue d'aider à cocréer et à enrichir notre histoire. Ensemble, nous avons le pouvoir d'apporter des changements significatifs, de modifier la structure de nos clients, de la société et d'IBM elle-même, d'avoir un effet vraiment positif et de faire de ce monde un meilleur endroit pour tous.

Le moment est venu de définir votre carrière.

À propos d'IBM

La plus grande invention d'IBM, c'est l'IBMiste. Nous sommes convaincus que la mise en application de l'intelligence, de la raison et de la science nous permet d'améliorer l'activité économique, la société et la condition humaine, en donnant vie à la puissance d'un nuage hybride ouvert et d'une stratégie d'IA pour nos clients et nos partenaires du monde entier.

Ayant réinventé sans relâche depuis 1911, nous ne sommes pas seulement l'une des plus grandes entreprises au monde, nous sommes aussi l'un des plus grands employeurs en TI et en services-conseils, avec de nombreuses entreprises du classement Fortune 50 s'appuyant sur IBM Cloud pour gérer leur entreprise.

Chez IBM, nous sommes fiers d'avoir été parmi les premiers à adopter l'intelligence artificielle, l'informatique quantique et la chaîne de blocs. C'est le moment de vous joindre à nous et de devenir un innovateur technologique responsable et une force au service du bien dans le monde.

Énoncé du lieu de travail

Pour obtenir de l’information supplémentaire sur les critères d’emplacement, veuillez contacter le recruteur après avoir soumis votre demande.

Vous et IBM

IBM s'engage à créer un milieu diversifié et est fière de souscrire au principe de l'égalité d'accès à l'emploi. Tous les candidats qualifiés seront pris en considération pour un emploi sans égard à la race, à la couleur, à la religion, ausexe, à l'identité ou à l'expression de genre, à l'orientation sexuelle, à l'origine nationale, à la génétique, à la grossesse, aux handicaps, à l'âge, au statut de vétéran ou à d'autres caractéristiques. IBM s'engage également à se conformer à toutes lespratiques équitables en matière d'emploi à l'égard du statut de citoyen et d'immigrant.

Effectively support the overall objectives of the Store including providing an exceptional level of customer service  

Assist with sales initiatives and develop strategies to increase retail sales  

Assist Store Manager in developing and motivating team members to help them reach their personal and career growth goals 

Support the Store Manager in managing the assets of the store including participating in regular inventories and keeping the store stocked and tidy 

Attends and participates in regular communication meetings held by the Store Manager 


#UAPCentral



 





Qualifications



To join our team, you need: 




College degree in business or equivalent experience 

5-8 years of relevant experience in a similar role  

Automotive aftermarket and parts supply background and/or knowledge  

Experience in personnel management  

Excellent communication and organization skills 

Strong computer literacy  


 





Additional Information



UAP is a diverse community that promotes inclusion and respect. The sum of our individual differences, experiences, knowledge, self-expression, unique capabilities, and talents, represents the richness of our culture. During the selection process, let us know if you need any accommodations. This information will be kept entirely confidential and will only be used to ensure you have a fair and pleasant experience with us

We will contact you as soon as possible if we think we have the hat for you!

Job Description




 We are Canada Life 


Being a part of Canada Life means you have a voice. This is a place where your unique background, perspectives and talents are valued, and shape our future success.

You can be your best here. You’re part of a diverse and inclusive workplace where your career and well-being are championed. You’ll have the opportunity to excel in your way, finding new and better ways to deliver exceptional customer and advisor experiences.

Together, as part of a great team, you’ll deliver on our shared purpose to improve the well-being of Canadians. It’s our driving force. Become part of a strong and successful company that’s trusted by millions of Canadians to do the right thing.

Be your best at Canada Life.

We are looking for an 
Account Manager, Group Benefits. 


Reporting to the Sales Director, the Account Manager will be responsible for the maintenance of productive relationships with Benefits Advisors and group policy holders, acquisition of new business, and management of accounts of an in‑force business portfolio. The successful candidate will work with a team to reach or exceed the objectives–sales, profitability, renewal, and persistency targets–set by management. The management of those targets requires great decision‑making ability, initiative, and creativity within a team.



What We Offer




 A dynamic work environment and competitive compensation package 

 The opportunity to work together with business partners and client companies 

 A flexible and stimulating work environment focused on collaboration 

 The opportunity to be part of a winning team 




What You Will Do




 Work together with Benefit Advisors to review quote specifications for potential clients, and write and present proposals to Advisors or potential clients 

 Perform all duties related to the management of accounts assigned, in particular financial duties such as annual account renewal 

 Ability to solve problems related to unusual or delicate claims and address financial matters for which guidelines are not available or act in cases where a decision must be taken after consultation with Field Management 

 Resourceful to develop and maintain relationships with Benefit Advisors and be attentive to their needs, so that they are excited to do business with Canada Life 




What You Will Bring




 Undergraduate diploma or equivalent 

 Minimum of five (5) years of experience in the field of group insurance and thorough knowledge of group life insurance, healthcare insurance, disability insurance, and underwriting 

 Excellent communication skills, both spoken and written with an enthusiasm for doing presentations 

 Excellent mathematical skills 

 Ability to act quickly and put forward innovative solutions 

 Ability to work in a fast‑evolving environment and adapt to growth and change 

 Strong sales and interpersonal skills as well as motivation to achieve business objectives 

 Knowledge of Word, Excel, and PowerPoint 

 Valid driver’s license and vehicle, given the travel needs 

 Designation of C.A.A.S. [certified group benefits advisor], GBA (Group Benefits Associate), or CEBS (Certified Employee Benefits Specialist) is a significant asset 



 Be your best at Canada Life- Apply today 



 We are one of Canada's top 100 employers! 


Canada Life serves the financial security needs of more than 13 million people across Canada, with additional operations in Europe and the United States. As members of the Power Financial Corporation group of companies, we’re one of Canada’s leading insurers with interests in life insurance, health insurance, investment and retirement savings. We offer a broad portfolio of financial and benefit plan solutions for individuals, families, businesses and organizations.

We are committed to providing an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees and customers feel valued, respected and supported. We are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of the communities in which we live, and to creating an environment where every employee  has the opportunity to  reach their potential.


 Canada Life would like to thank all applicants, however only those who qualify for an interview will be contacted

industries: Marketing Services, Non-profit Organizations, and Wellness and Fitness Services
description:
Job Title: Club Sales Manager at Anytime Fitness Coaching Facility - Ingersoll



Job Summary



What motivates you? Your family’s security? The ability to help people in need through Health and Fitness? Ability to be financially stable? Yes is always the answer and we want you to succeed.

We are looking to hire a Club Sales Manager who will be in charge of selling memberships, coaching (training), operating a fitness club, and driving the overall growth in the business, which in return will grow your financial portfolio.

A perfect applicant will be a team leader, have a passion for health and fitness, and most importantly, be a great representative of the Anytime Fitness brand! To be considered for this position, you must have high-energy, possess an extroverted personality, and be a strong motivator. Ideally, you will have prior experience in sales, marketing, and building club culture. Experience within the fitness industry is not required, however, sales experience, first-rate people skills and a self-motivated work ethic are!



What We Offer




 Competitive market salary with commission

 Lucrative bonus structure

 2 weeks paid vacation annually

 Fun working environment and culture

 Rewarding career with opportunity for growth within Anytime Fitness

 Ability to have a positive impact on client’s lives through health and fitness

 Salary of $35,000 - $50,000

 $2000 signing bonus offered after 90 days of employment




Responsibilities/Duties




 Managing leads, and recruiting new prospects

 Providing exceptional customer service and a welcoming environment for all

 Selling coaching and memberships

 Ensuring the club is meeting Weekly/Monthly sales goals

 Maintaining the day to day upkeep of the facility

 Overseeing coaching sessions and ensuring coaching staff are creating an exceptional experience.

 Maintaining social media, engagement, and community involvement

 Driving growth at your club location




Qualifications/Requirements




 Must be 18 years of age or older

 Must have a valid driver’s license and reliable method of transportation

 Prior customer service and sales experience required

 Leadership qualities

 Passion for helping others

 Passion for fitness




Education And Experience




 High school diploma or equivalent required

 Proficiency with Microsoft Suite

 Experience in fitness is an asset

 Social media experience is an asset

 Sales experience is an asset




Physical Requirements




 Must be able to lift up to 50 pounds at times.


Once you apply, you will receive an email survey for you to complete. Please complete the survey in order to be considered for next steps.

Autres compétences recherchées : Capacité de présenter le matériel et d’assurer le dialogue entre les cadres et le personnel technique; expérience de l’élaboration de soumissions, de présentations techniques, et de diagrammes d’architecture; expérience des tâches de soutien/conseils aux ventes et de vente de solutions; capacité de diriger une équipe.

Emplacement


Principales Responsabilités




 Promouvoir la valeur d’IBM par des discussions et ateliers en matière d’architecture.

 Mener des évaluations de la valeur en matière de sécurité, préparer des rapports et présenter leurs conclusions et recommandations.

 Définir la stratégie technique relative à des occasions commerciales.

 Diriger la collecte et l’analyse des exigences.

 Concevoir des solutions de sécurité en faisant appel aux capacités de Sécurité IBM.

 Donner des présentations à l’intention de clients et participer à des discussions de tableau blanc.

 Faire partie intégrante d’une équipe des ventes.

 Être responsable d’importantes relations de direction.

 Favoriser le succès des clients en matière de sécurité.



Les candidats retenus pour un poste à Montréal, QC, doivent être parfaitement bilingues en anglais et en français.

IBMReferred_NorthAmerica

Expertise professionnelle et technique requise



Le candidat doit être bilingue (anglais et français).

La désignation CISSP ou la désignation de sécurité sont d’importants atouts.

La compréhension des technologies IBM est un atout.

Haut niveau de compétence technique.

Capacité de bien travailler en équipe.

Goût de la résolution de problèmes et des solutions d’architecture.

Leader ayant d’excellentes habiletés en matière de présentation.



Expertise professionnelle et technique privilégié

Doit avoir la capacité de travailler au Canada sans parrainage.

A propos de l'unité commerciale

Alimentée par les technologies cognitives, plus de 150 offres SaaS, et des aperçus en temps réel, l'équipe des marchés mondiaux offre une expertise intégrée afin d'aider nos clients à prendre de meilleures décisions et à innover tout en collaborant avec leurs clients, partenaires et fournisseurs. Rejoignez-nous afin de continuer à stimuler l'innovation avec le portefeuille le plus complet pour les entreprises de tous les secteurs d'activité.

Votre vie chez IBM

Envie d'en savoir plus? Prêt à résoudre certains des défis parmi les plus uniques au monde? Et prêt à façonner l'avenir de millions de personnes?

Si c'est le cas, il est alors temps de vous joindre à nous, d'exprimer votre individualité, de laisser le champ libre à votre curiosité et d'explorer de nouvelles possibilités.

Chaque IBMiste (ou IBMiste potentiel comme vous) dispose d'une voix, trace son propre chemin et propose son expertise en vue d'aider à cocréer et à enrichir notre histoire. Ensemble, nous avons le pouvoir d'apporter des changements significatifs, de modifier la structure de nos clients, de la société et d'IBM elle-même, d'avoir un effet vraiment positif et de faire de ce monde un meilleur endroit pour tous.

Le moment est venu de définir votre carrière.

À propos d'IBM

La plus grande invention d'IBM, c'est l'IBMiste. Nous sommes convaincus que la mise en application de l'intelligence, de la raison et de la science nous permet d'améliorer l'activité économique, la société et la condition humaine, en donnant vie à la puissance d'un nuage hybride ouvert et d'une stratégie d'IA pour nos clients et nos partenaires du monde entier.

Ayant réinventé sans relâche depuis 1911, nous ne sommes pas seulement l'une des plus grandes entreprises au monde, nous sommes aussi l'un des plus grands employeurs en TI et en services-conseils, avec de nombreuses entreprises du classement Fortune 50 s'appuyant sur IBM Cloud pour gérer leur entreprise.

Chez IBM, nous sommes fiers d'avoir été parmi les premiers à adopter l'intelligence artificielle, l'informatique quantique et la chaîne de blocs. C'est le moment de vous joindre à nous et de devenir un innovateur technologique responsable et une force au service du bien dans le monde.

Énoncé du lieu de travail

Pour obtenir de l’information supplémentaire sur les critères d’emplacement, veuillez contacter le recruteur après avoir soumis votre demande.

Vous et IBM

IBM s'engage à créer un milieu diversifié et est fière de souscrire au principe de l'égalité d'accès à l'emploi. Tous les candidats qualifiés seront pris en considération pour un emploi sans égard à la race, à la couleur, à la religion, ausexe, à l'identité ou à l'expression de genre, à l'orientation sexuelle, à l'origine nationale, à la génétique, à la grossesse, aux handicaps, à l'âge, au statut de vétéran ou à d'autres caractéristiques. IBM s'engage également à se conformer à toutes lespratiques équitables en matière d'emploi à l'égard du statut de citoyen et d'immigrant.

About ALPHASHINE


ALPHASHINE is a Toronto-based start-up that provides detailing and aesthetic services to our clients. Founded in 2019, ALPHASHINE has expanded across multiple locations in Toronto and continues to expand across North America. ALPHASHINE’s goal is to reshape the industry through customer-centricity, modernization, and inclusivity.

Furthermore, the company aims to be at the forefront of innovation for the industry, leveraging the usage of technological advancements.

Alongside providing excellent services to our clients, ALPHASHINE is partnered with other brands that are also looking to innovate and become the best in their respective industries. Currently, the brand is partnered with dealerships, such as Maserati and Porsche, as well as other innovative companies such as Redbull.





Our Values:



Customer-Centricity:
 Curate a culture that focuses on creating a personalized customer experience that exceeds client needs and expectations.


Accessibility and Convenience:
 Constantly innovate to create a seamless system that prioritizes accessibility, convenience, and ease of use for our clients.


Diversity and Inclusion:
 By embracing diversity and inclusivity in our workspace, we strive to deliver ideas and services that better reflect our client base





Our Culture:


Our team is driven to meet the highest standards, constantly learning how to improve our quality and efficiency. All ALPHASHINE associates are also dedicated to our work and the clients that we serve focused on creating the best experience for our clientele. The environment has a collaborative environment where all members of the team can contribute new ideas. Every member on our team has a mindset that is always looking to change and grow, highly valuing flexibility among individuals.






Position: Account Executive







Responsibilities:


- Driving new and reoccurring sales for the organization via (Phone, Email, In-person, fieldwork, etc.)

- Maintaining a client list and establishing strong relationships with ALPHASHINE members and clients

- Perform administrative duties including answering phones, inquiries through email, scheduling appointments

- Process payments by creating invoices and processing card or cash payments

- Maintain good relationships with clients and members

- Work alongside Service Manager for service completion time and daily schedule

- Drive membership sign-ups

- Tracking daily operations and reporting or resolving issues

- Create active leads and generate, maintain, and foster B2B relationships

- Track sales behaviors using compiled sales data on Excel





Requirements:



- This is not a remote opportunity.


- Minimum 1 year of Customer Services, Sales, or Administrative role

- Competency in storing, managing, and analyzing sales data on Excel

- Completion of post-secondary education (strongly preferred)

- Excellent communication and writing skills

- Strong computer proficiency

- Hard-working, friendly, growth mindset

- Strong organizational skills

- Ability to work under pressure and in a fast-paced environment

What Will You Do?




We are seeking an accomplished Major Enterprise Account Manager to join our growing Sales organization in the Toronto, Canada metro area. In this role you will act as a trusted advisor to C-levels within a list of 3-4 major enterprise accounts to achieve business revenue goals.  



Arista appeals to forward-thinking organizations that value quality and innovation. Consequently, technical acumen and a track record of selling data center solutions is highly desirable.




Job Responsibilities:





Exceed measurable sales objectives and extend the Arista brand within 3-4 major enterprise accounts in the Toronto metro area. You may also be tasked with also developing new white space major accounts.

You will be responsible for utilizing a consultative selling approach with C-level and VP level stakeholders to address the business needs of hybrid cloud computing and siloed legacy IT systems across the Arista product portfolio including our Leaf-Spine Switches, EOS (Award winning open source network OS),Data Center and Cognitive Campus Networking solutions including our Wifi cloud based solutions, Cloud Vision (Network Automation & Telemetry), NDR and Endpoint security solutions. 

Meet with key influencers, decision-makers, and C-levels to present Arista’s value proposition.

Work with Arista systems engineers to design and position compelling solutions that drive down the total cost of ownership.

Collaborate with technology partners to identify prospects and demonstrate best-in-class solutions

Establish and manage key channel relationships in your territory.

Formulate strategic and tactical account plans based on periodic business reviews with your prospects and customers.

Conduct demand generation activities such as happy hours, lunch-n-learns and technology forums.

Collaborate with Arista peers on marketing plans and best practices.

Keep up-to-date with technology partner solutions, competing solutions and competitor strategies.



The Team




This position will typically report to a Regional Sales Director or Regional VP of Sales. You will be part of a team that includes the best field engineers in the cloud networking industry. And, you will have the support of our industry-leading Arista TAC, proof-of-concept resources and executive team.





Qualifications




Who Are You? 




We are seeking a Sales leader who possesses a hunter mentality and has a proven track record of technology sales including cultivating relationships with existing Global 2000 accounts. You are an influencer and possess the ability to act as a trusted advisor to deliver business value to both end users and key business stakeholders.



Our team looks for individuals who are passionate about disrupting the status quo and embody our values of trust, compassion, collaboration, respectfulness, integrity, and good-natured fun.




Minimum Job Requirements:





BS/BA degree or equivalent in addition to 10+ years of technology sales experience.

Proven track record of direct selling into Global 2000 (Major) accounts within the assigned territory and exceeding sales targets

You posses the ability to lead cross functional teams in the pursuit and capture of multi-million dollars sales deals at the C-level. 

You possess relevant data center or networking (LAN/WAN, SDN) industry background from a technology partner, competitor, channel partner or end user is a a requirement. 

Strong rolodex and relationships within the territory

Excellent people skills and ability to build relationships at all levels

You possess previous selling experience and technical acumen in one or more of the following areas; Networking, SDN, NFV, Switching, Network Automation, Routing, Data Center, Edge Computing, Network Virtualization, Hyper-converged infrastructure or Cloud computing.




Additional Information



All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

job_title: Assistant Store Manager - Vaughan Mills - Retail
industries: Retail Apparel and Fashion, Manufacturing, and Retail
description:
Job Description



The Assistant Store Manager, through execution of Store Manager directives, assists in maximizing sales, creating a positive, fun and outwardly-friendly environment, guiding store operations to meet brand standards and Key Performance Indicator (KPI) targets, as well as ensuring our customers receive excellent customer service. The Assistant Store Manager is responsible for store operations in absence of the Store Manager.

As an 
Assistant Store Manager
, your primary responsibilities will include:

OPERATIONS


Manage the operations of the store in the absence of the Store Manager

Provide exceptional customer service and shopping experiences for our customers; being a strong brand ambassador through knowledge and understanding of our products

Work in partnership with the Store Manager to help meet and exceed all company set sales and operational goals

Drive sales through leadership and coaching on the sales floor

Communicate field and/or market data to the appropriate department leaders when required

Assist the Store Manager in all merchandising, marketing and visual presentation aspects of the store

Receive and process company product accurately and efficiently while preserving the organization of the backroom

Maintain replenishment of product on the sales floor to company standards

Support the Store Manager with securing company assets through the implementation of loss prevention policies and procedures

Maintain a safe and clean store environment for our team members and customers. Participate in store housekeeping duties.

Ensure the compliance of all company and store policies and procedures

Contribute to store and region success by accomplishing related results as needed


HUMAN RESOURCES


Assist the Store Manager in hiring, training and supervising the performance of our team members

Assist the Store Manager to ensure the successful onboarding and training of new team members

Support the Store Manager with employee performance management

Model the Carter’s Company Values and Leadership Behaviours




Required Experience




2+ years' retail management or supervisory experience

High energy, enthusiastic team leader with a proven dedication to customer service

Interest in growing your career into a Store Manager role

A history of meeting and/or exceeding KPIs

Strong leadership, interpersonal and customer service skills. Ability to motivate others.

Strong attention to detail and organizational skills

Excellent visual merchandising abilities

Working knowledge of computers

Effective verbal and written communication skills




Physical Demands




Ability to lift up to 25 lbs

Ability to move and replace fixtures, shelves and hardware throughout the store

Ability to use ladders on a frequent basis

Capacity to stand for long periods


Availability Requirements

Availability to meet the needs of the business that may include days, nights, weekends and holidays as scheduled.

Eight hour shifts up to 40 hours per week: including evenings, weekends, holidays and occasional overnights. A minimum of two closing shifts a week and a weekend shift.


NOTE: This job description is not intended to be all-inclusive. The duties described may be changed or reassigned at the discretion of management, and the employee may be required to perform duties that are not listed in the job description.

industries: Construction, Facilities Services, and Truck Transportation
description:
OAKRIDGE LANDSCAPE CONTRACTORS has a need for a Bulk Sales / Landscape Supply Manager to join our dynamic team of talented individuals!



Company Overview




With over 25 years of award-winning experience in landscape and landscape construction, we stand firmly behind our work and our employees.

Join a team that helps our clients realize their dreams. Oakridge provides a wide variety of landscape supplies for both residential and commercial projects.

We take pride in our ability to create and specialize in a number of different screened topsoil blends. Our products include also include mulch, compost, river rock, brick sand, and other landscape materials.




Job Details




Position: Bulk Sales Manager (Seasonal-winter work available).

Location: Hamilton, Ontario.

Pay: $25 per hour (Benefits after 3 months).




Job Duties




The Bulk Sales Manager will manage the daily operations of Oakridge Landscape Contractors' bulk retail department and assist customers with landscape materials purchases.

This position also includes the use of numerous types of related equipment.




Key Duties & Responsibilities




Operate skid steer.

Assist with bulk deliveries in a 3-ton dump trunk (Class G).

Ensure all essential product is stocked.

Coordinate all deliveries with the Equipment and Yard Superintendent.

Supervise and schedule bulk division staff.

Build and maintain strong customer relations.

Assist customers with the loading of materials.

Operate cash register and credit/debit machine.

Receive payments from customers and bring them to the account manager at end of the day.




Requirements




G Driver's license.

Clean Driver’s Abstract.

Reliable transportation.

Ability to take direction.

Basic understanding of construction and landscaping.

Available to work weekends.

Experience operating skid steer, willing to train the right candidate.

Strong sales and supervisory experience is an asset.

Strong knowledge of job safety and safe work habits.



Oakridge Group is an equal opportunity employer and welcomes applications from all interested parties. If you are a person with a disability and have a question or require assistance with the application process, please contact by email.




About Oakridge Landscape Contractors



Oakridge Landscape Contractors specializes in landscape applications for industrial, commercial, institutional, parks, heritage sites, and highway road infrastructure restoration.Our extensive landscape construction knowledge and installation abilities combined with our team, sub trade relationships and central location allow our company to complete both large and small scale successfully.

We are a solutions-driven, customer-focused provider of material handling, storage, and automated systems solutions and we take pride in knowing that your actions boost our customers’ productivity. We are looking for customer-focused, self-starting individuals to join our team and make a difference. If that sounds like you, join the Johnston Equipment team today!



Position Summary



The National Leasing Sales Specialist is a product expert and assists in all matters that relate to Leasing and Leasing Sales. They will review leasing information and deliver advice on individual sales opportunities to customers, ensure targets are met and will develop and deliver training sessions and presentations to sales representatives on its sales model.

The ideal candidate enjoys interacting with customers, problem-solving, devising solutions, relentless, resilient, and don't give up in the face of objections; rather, they work with customers towards a solution that meets their business objectives. They are analytical to evaluate customers, sales, and quantitative information, determine areas for improvement, and join forces with others in figuring out best practices and strategies to achieve their goals and the goals of the sales department.



How You’ll Make An Impact



With your desire to develop the leasing business to become increasingly profitable, leverage your knowledge to help others exceed their targets and your understanding that there is a solution to every problem, you will be able to achieve your goals and directly impact the sales and revenue of the company.


Uphold product expertise in the areas of leasing and leasing sales, being the subject matter expert within the business for other sales representatives and customers

Effectively partner with customers, understanding their business objectives, to help them grow their business through our warehouse automation and storage solutions

Profitably demonstrate the value of GNJ's equipment and leasing solutions to increase sales in the leasing business

Make outbound sales calls or receive inbound sales calls related to leasing material handling equipment product

Correspond with customers to understand their unique and specialized financing needs in accordance with our leasing solution

Create customer-specific presentations to demonstrate the value of various financing solutions

Provide consultation to corporate level executives to understand their business objectives and structure the appropriate business solutions to their needs

Work with the Sales Manager to understand their unique regional deficiencies and to work with the regional sales representatives to win additional Leasing business

Work with Sales Management, Credit, Asset Management, Warehouse Automation and Storage Solutions departments in structuring an overall comprehensive solution in coordination with the leasing department structure

Provide support to the internal leasing staff in all areas of leasing

Work with senior management on specialized projects in clarifying leasing values and specialized leasing information to assist customers in their concerns and close sales

Resolve customer escalations and then work with corresponding departments to execute an optimal solution

Review CRM information and analyze customer data to conduct informational sales sessions with sales representatives on strategies to successfully win deals

Analyze sales activities and report to senior GNJ management on the status of conversion rates in the area of leasing

Work with the customer dispute team to resolve outstanding lease issues, including visiting customers, working with internal staff, and drawing in resources to execute the negotiated resolution for the customer

Provide training to new hires and existing sales representatives on effectively selling leasing products

Work on internal promotions and ensure that the marketing material and website is adequate, effective, and accurately reflects our leasing offerings




What You’ll Bring To The Table




A University degree would be preferred with a specialization in Business (Commerce/Management). MBA is desirable.

The ideal individual will possess a minimum of 5 years of experience in the material handling and leasing industry

Direct sales background (understanding the sales process - originating leads, pitching, and closing).

A proven record of exceptional performance in growing and scaling organizations in a similar role.

Previous success in collaborating with multiple stakeholders with varying interests to reach mutually beneficial outcomes.

Strong quantitative/analytical skills

Strategic thinker and agile problem-solver, while simultaneously driving a rigorous, data-driven approach to understanding the environment and driving for results.



Why You’ll love it here



We offer a competitive salary, incentive program, and an excellent benefits package

We trust and support you - take ownership of your work and push your ideas from inception to execution

We want to see you grow - we support your career progression and provide learning and development opportunities 


While we appreciate all applications we receive, we advise that only candidates under consideration will be contacted.


G.N. Johnston Equipment is committed to building a diverse and inclusive workplace. Qualified designated group members are encouraged to apply as any reasonable accommodation of qualifications will be considered as per our Accommodation Policy, available upon request.




About Johnston Equipment



Johnston Equipment provides material handling equipment to move product in, out and throughout warehouses; service solutions and tools to better manage warehouse productivity; racking, storage and automated system solutions to optimize the storage and movement of goods; and programs to protect material handling assets and the people who utilize them. We are continually striving to create better and more advanced solutions as well as provide the highest quality service.

We are growing and need talented professionals to drive our vision to create an effortless experience for our customers by delivering our products and services in an efficient and safe manner. Join us…. Make a difference!

description:
Store Sales Associate – Part time



Ask us how you can earn up to $500 for referring your friends and family


Do you want to be a vital part of a fast-paced & collaborative team environment while working part-time for an exceptional company with fantastic employee benefits and competitive pay? Then look no further, PPG is a Fortune 200 company, functioning globally with over 45,000 employees, and growing! We offer medical, dental and vision, starting with 3 weeks of vacation, PLUS paid holidays and retirement benefits. Management focused on promoting from within, so if you are looking for phenomenal benefits and career growth potential, then PPG is the company for you!

Located at: 1556 Main St W, Hamilton, ON L8S 1E7, a 

Store Sales Associate

, is the reason our customers come back! They will be excited to see your friendly face because of the outstanding, timely customer service you will provide and the important relationships you will develop with our regular contractors and new customers every day!



Key Responsibilities




Evaluate customer needs and propose solutions

Color and match paint products

Make sure the store is clean and well stocked

Lift, move and store the product from the store in accordance with the safety instructions.

Work in a retail environment with in-store responsibilities




Qualifications




Must be at least 18 years old 

Computer and internet proficiency

1-3 years of retail sales and customer service experience

Ability to work flexible sales hours, including evenings and weekends

Ability to lift up to 80lbs at times but 40-60lbs on a regular basis




WHY Work for PPG?




Competitive Benefits Plan which includes, Medical, Dental, Prescription Drug, Life Insurance and Disability coverage

Start with 2 weeks of vacation, plus Paid holidays

Retirement Savings Program which includes a Company Matching Program

Performance based Salary & Incentive increases

Opportunity for Advancement and Relocation to any of our 260+ Locations

PLUS many more to offer



PPG: WE PROTECT AND BEAUTIFY THE WORLD™




About Us



Here at PPG, we make it happen, and we seek candidates of the highest integrity and professionalism who share our values, with the commitment and drive to strive today to do better than yesterday – everyday.

Through leadership in innovation, sustainability and color, PPG helps customers in industrial, transportation, consumer products, and construction markets and aftermarkets to enhance more surfaces in more ways than does any other company. To learn more, visit www.ppg.com and follow @ PPG on Twitter.



The PPG Way





Every Single Day At PPG



We partner with customers to create mutual value.

We are insightful, dedicated and proactive. We have intimate knowledge of the market and our customers. We focus on practical solutions that make a difference.

We are “One PPG” to the world.

We are better and stronger together. We leverage our scale to reach new markets and introduce innovative technologies as we differentiate and disrupt our markets.

We trust our people every day, in every way.

We enable and empower our people to make the right decisions. We are inclusive, transparent and respectful. Our feedback is clear and actionable.

We make it happen.

We have a passion for winning. We achieve. We deliver with discipline and integrity. We bring our best energy to our work. We decide and act intelligently and quickly.

We run it like we own it.

We respect one another by being responsible and accountable. We always act in the best interest of our company, customers, shareholders and our communities.

We do better today than yesterday – everyday.

We continuously learn. We develop our people to grow our businesses.

PPG Way: (Click here to learn more about the PPG Way)
