Maintains current knowledge of personal banking and credit card industries, practices, and trends and integrates into customer conversations.

Builds effective relationships with internal/external stakeholders.

Maintains the confidentiality of customer and Bank information.

Identifies and reports suspicious patterns of activity that are suspected to be related to money laundering.

Complies with all legal and regulatory requirements for the jurisdiction.

Focus may be on a business/group.

Thinks creatively and proposes new solutions.

Exercises judgment to identify, diagnose, and solve problems within given rules.

Works mostly independently.

Broader work or accountabilities may be assigned as needed. Qualifications:

Typically between 3 - 5 years of relevant experience and post-secondary degree in related field of study or an equivalent combination of education and experience.

1-3 years of banking or customer service/sales or equivalent experience.

Previous supervisory or management experience - preferred.

General knowledge of retail banking products and services.

General knowledge of applicable regulations, audit standards, and related policies, procedures, and directives.

Working knowledge of competitive marketplace and trends in product offerings.

Working knowledge of branch operational processes and policies.

Working knowledge of branch technologies, processes, and performance metrics.

Specialized knowledge from education and/or business experience.

Verbal & written communication skills - In-depth.

Collaboration & team skills - In-depth.

Analytical and problem solving skills - In-depth.

Influence skills - In-depth.



We’re here to help


At BMO we are driven by a shared Purpose: Boldly Grow the Good in business and life. It calls on us to create lasting, positive change for our customers, our communities and our people. By working together, innovating and pushing boundaries, we transform lives and businesses, and power economic growth around the world.

As a member of the BMO team you are valued, respected and heard, and you have more ways to grow and make an impact. We strive to help you make an impact from day one – for yourself and our customers. We’ll support you with the tools and resources you need to reach new milestones, as you help our customers reach theirs. From in-depth training and coaching, to manager support and network-building opportunities, we’ll help you gain valuable experience, and broaden your skillset.

To find out more visit us at https://jobs.bmo.com/ca/en.

BMO is committed to an inclusive, equitable and accessible workplace. By learning from each other’s differences, we gain strength through our people and our perspectives. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. To request accommodation, please contact your recruiter.

The GitLab DevOps platform empowers 100,000+ organizations to deliver software faster and more efficiently. We are one of the world’s largest all-remote companies with 1,600+ team members and values that guide a culture where people embrace the belief that everyone can contribute .

We value results, transparency, sharing, freedom, efficiency, self-learning , frugality, collaboration, directness, kindness, diversity, inclusion and belonging, boring solutions, and quirkiness. If these values match your personality, work ethic, and personal goals, we encourage you to visit our primer to learn more. Open source is our culture, our way of life, our story, and what makes us truly unique.



Responsibilities




 Strategic Account Leader will report to an Area Sales Manager or Regional Director. 

 Act as a primary point of contact and the face of GitLab for our strategic and large prospects. 

 Contribute to root cause analysis on wins/losses. 

 Communicate lessons learned to the team, including account managers, the marketing team, and the technical team. 

 Take ownership of your book of business 

 document the buying criteria 

 document the buying process 

 document next steps and owners 

 ensure pipeline accuracy based on evidence and not hope 

 Contribute to documenting improvements in our sales handbook . 

 Provide account leadership and direction in the pre- and post-sales process 

 Conduct sales activities including prospecting and developing opportunities in large/strategic accounts 

 Ensure the successful rollout and adoption of GitLab products through strong account management activities and coordination with pre-and-post sales engineering and support resources 

 Be the voice of the customer by contributing product ideas to our public issue tracker 

 Travel as necessary to accounts in order to develop relationships and close large opportunities 

 Generate qualified leads and develop new customers in conjunction with our strategic channel partners in exceeding quota. 

 Expand knowledge of industry as well as the competitive posture of the company 

 Prepare activity and forecast reports as requested 

 Update and maintain Sales’ database as appropriate 

 Assist sales management in conveying customer needs to product managers, and technical support staff 

 Utilize a consultative approach, discuss business issues with prospect and develop a formal quote, a written sales proposal or a formal sales presentation addressing their business needs. 

 Respond to RFP's and follow up with prospects. 

 Develop an account plan to sell to customers based on their business needs. 

 Build and strengthen the business relationship with current accounts and new prospects. 

 Recommend marketing strategies. 




Requirements




 A true desire to see customers benefit from the investment they make with you 

 Able to provide high degree of major account management and control 

 Work under minimal supervision on complex projects 

 Proven success with B2B software sales 

 Experience selling into large organizations 

 Interest in GitLab, and open source software 

 Ability to leverage established relationships and proven sales techniques for success 

 Effective communicator (written/verbal), strong interpersonal skills 

 Motivated, driven and results oriented 

 Excellent negotiation, presentation and closing skills 

 Preferred experience with Git, Software Development Tools, Application Lifecycle Management 

 You share our values , and work in accordance with those values. 

 Ability to use GitLab 




Hiring Process



Additional details about our process can be found on our hiring page .



Top 10 Reasons To Work For GitLab




 Work with helpful, kind, motivated, and talented people. 

 Work remote so you have no commute and are free to travel and move. 

 Have flexible work hours so you are there for other people and free to plan the day how you like. 

 Everyone works remote, but you don't feel remote. We don't have a head office, so you're not in a satellite office. 

 Work on open source software so you can interact with a large community and can show your work. 

 Work on a product you use every day: we drink our own wine. 

 Work on a product used by lots of people that care about what you do. 

 As a company we contribute more than we take, most of our work is released as the open source GitLab CE. 

 Focused on results, not on long hours, so that you can have a life and don't burn out. 

 Open internal processes: know what you're getting in to and be assured we're thoughtful and effective. 


See our culture page for more!

Work remotely from anywhere in the world. Curious to see what that looks like? Check out our remote manifesto and guides .



Compensation



To view the full job description and its compensation calculator, view our handbook. The compensation calculator can be found towards the bottom of the page.

Additional details about our process can be found on our hiring page .

LI-KR-GITLAB

Remote-Global


Country Hiring Guidelines: 
GitLab hires new team members in countries around the world. All of our roles are remote, however some roles may carry specific location-based eligibility requirements. Our Talent Acquisition team can help answer any questions about location after starting the recruiting process.


Privacy Policy: 
Please review our Recruitment Privacy Policy. Your privacy is important to us.

GitLab is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. GitLab’s policies and practices relating to recruitment, employment, career development and advancement, promotion, and retirement are based solely on merit, regardless of race, color, religion, ancestry, sex (including pregnancy, lactation, sexual orientation, gender identity, or gender expression), national origin, age, citizenship, marital status, mental or physical disability, genetic information (including family medical history), discharge status from the military, protected veteran status (which includes disabled veterans, recently separated veterans, active duty wartime or campaign badge veterans, and Armed Forces service medal veterans), or any other basis protected by law. GitLab will not tolerate discrimination or harassment based on any of these characteristics. See also GitLab’s EEO Policy and EEO is the Law . 514570BR


Introduction


IBM Consulting: Join a leader. Consult with us.

IBM Consulting seeks to hire a Business Development Manager. The Business Development Manager will work within a team to identify and qualify opportunities while working in a collaborative environment. Their sales efforts and accomplishments will address the most strategic requirements of the prospective client and promise both short-term and long-term revenue for IBM. The Business Development Manager (a sales role) maintains an effective business relationship with the client's management team and influences the overall success of IBM Consulting offerings within the Canadian marketplace. They will work to determine the client’s needs and translate these needs into solutions and thus opportunities for IBM.


Your Role and Responsibilities




Identify, validate and drive new opportunities

Drive an annual signings and revenue target while accurately forecasting revenue, managing a sales funnel and overall results

Perform extensive prospecting within a set of identified accounts across Canada

Lead/own the service sales deals for selected opportunities through the full lifecycle

Provide client coverage and coordinate face-to-face and program coverage

Work with subject matter experts to develop solutions for qualified clients

Support the development and maintenance of overall IBM Consulting results

Lead/support account management activities in conjunction with existing account teams

Participate and support in delivery activities to maintain account and client continuity




Required Technical and Professional Expertise




Demonstrated strategic selling skills preferred, including management of a sales team

Track record of achieving/exceeding sales targets

Proven success in prospecting and managing a territory and/or growing presence within a portfolio of accounts

Knowledge of industrial and/or distribution industries in support of go-to-market activities

Experience in building relationships with corporate-level executives

Experience managing small pursuits as well as large scale complex proposals




Teaming Skills Required




5-10 years experience in performing consultative selling

5-10 years experience in Industrial / Distribution sector




Preferred Technical And Professional Expertise


As above

Must have the ability to work in Canada without sponsorship.


About Business Unit


IBM Consulting is IBM’s consulting and global professional services business, with market leading capabilities in business and technology transformation. With deep expertise in many industries, we offer strategy, experience, technology, and operations services to many of the most innovative and valuable companies in the world. Our people are focused on accelerating our clients’ businesses through the power of collaboration. We believe in the power of technology responsibly used to help people, partners and the planet.

This role requires you to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 prior to your start date. Full vaccination refers to receiving dosage of COVID-19 vaccines that provide full protection in accordance with Canada Public Health and WHO guidance (full series of a 2 dose vaccine plus 14 days or a one dose vaccine plus 14 days from the last dose). Proof of vaccination status will be required. Booster vaccination requirements may be required. If you are unable to be vaccinated due to medical or religious reasons, we offer accommodations in accordance with applicable law.


Your Life @ IBM


Are you craving to learn more? Prepared to solve some of the world's most unique challenges? And ready to shape the future for millions of people? If so, then it's time to join us, express your individuality, unleash your curiosity and discover new possibilities.

Every IBMer, and potential ones like yourself, has a voice, carves their own path, and uses their expertise to help co-create and add to our story. Together, we have the power to make meaningful change – to alter the fabric of our clients, of society and IBM itself, to create a truly positive impact and make the world work better for everyone.

It's time to define your career.


About IBM


IBM’s greatest invention is the IBMer. We believe that through the application of intelligence, reason and science, we can improve business, society and the human condition, bringing the power of an open hybrid cloud and AI strategy to life for our clients and partners around the world.

Restlessly reinventing since 1911, we are not only one of the largest corporate organizations in the world, we’re also one of the biggest technology and consulting employers, with many of the Fortune 50 companies relying on the IBM Cloud to run their business.

At IBM, we pride ourselves on being an early adopter of artificial intelligence, quantum computing and blockchain. Now it’s time for you to join us on our journey to being a responsible technology innovator and a force for good in the world.


Location Statement


For additional information about location requirements, please discuss with the recruiter following submission of your application.


Being You @ IBM


IBM is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, pregnancy, disability, age, veteran status, or other characteristics. IBM is also committed to compliance with all fair employment practices regarding citizenship and immigration status.

description:
Sales Agronomist


Job Description


At Richardson, the work we do is essential. Every day, we work together to ensure a steady food supply for people around the world. They count on us to perform our roles consistently and responsibly. For this important reason, we are committed to remaining operational throughout the COVID-19 pandemic. As always, we maintain a strong focus on safety and quality assurance.

For more information about how we are taking additional precautions to protect the health and well-being of our candidates, colleagues, and customers, visit our Career Opportunities page.

At Richardson International, being truly invested is at the heart of everything we do. For over 160 years, Richardson has been dedicated to Canadian agriculture. Recognized as a global leader in agriculture and food processing, Richardson is one of Canada’s Best Managed Companies. Richardson has approximately 3,000 employees across Canada, the U.S. and the U.K. At Richardson, we are committed to enhancing our facilities and services and investing in our people and our communities.

Richardson Pioneer, a division of Richardson International, is Canada’s leading agribusiness. Richardson Pioneer supports Canadian farmers throughout the growing season – providing agronomic services and advice, selling crop inputs, buying their crops at harvest and selling them to markets around the world through the most efficient network of high throughput Ag Business Centres in Western Canada.

Working with Richardson opens the door to a world of possibility. We currently have an opportunity for a 
Sales Agronomist 
at our Richardson Pioneer Ag Business Centre located in 
Minnedosa, MB
. Sales Agronomists contribute to the overall success of our customers and our business - you are the one who our customers rely on for agronomic support and advice.


Responsibilities:



Visit producers on their farms and identify their agricultural needs specific to agronomy and crop production, contributing to increased sales volumes and overall location profitability

Provide agronomic services such as soil testing and recommendation of crop products

Develop opportunities for live demonstrations and tours with customers




Qualifications:



A degree in Agriculture and previous experience in crop inputs

Strong communication and organizational skills

The Certified Crop Advisor designation would be considered an asset



Richardson International provides an excellent compensation package consisting of competitive salary, pension, a flexible benefits plan and training and career development opportunities.

Interested candidates should click the 
Apply
 icon to apply online by 
March 28, 2022
.

Richardson International values diversity in the workplace. Women, Aboriginal People, Visible Minorities and persons with disabilities are encouraged to apply and self-identify.

job_title: Technical Product Manager - Simulation SaaS Platform
description:
Siemens Digital Industries Software is a leading provider of solutions for the design, simulation and manufacture of products across many different industries. Formula 1 cars, skyscrapers, ships, space exploration vehicles, and many of the objects we see in our daily lives are being conceived and manufactured using our Product Lifecycle Management (PLM) software.

The promise of a digital future…today. With the digital twin, Siemens Digital Industries Software blurs the boundaries between the virtual and physical, hardware and software, design and manufacturing worlds. 

For more information about us visit - https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=k6mVLaUyO4U





What we’re looking for:





Are you interested in building the next generation of cloud-based simulation? The Simcenter SaaS platform is changing the way Siemens customers use engineering simulation software to create amazing new products. We are building a service that gives any engineer access to simulation on demand globally, without having to invest in sophisticated and expensive on-premise software deployments. Our goal is to make the Simcenter SaaS platform the easiest, most flexible, way to get engineering insights, in the shortest possible time.

The Simcenter SaaS team are looking for an experienced, talented technical product manager to own the product vision for the SaaS Simulation Platform. This is a high visibility role, requiring you to work closely with both customers and our development teams. You will be the voice of the customer in front of senior leadership, sales and marketing. As the Product Manager you can drive the strategy required to create a best-in-class cloud native user interface with a collaborative data management backbone.





Responsibilities:





As a Product Management leader, you are part of the software delivery organization at Siemens. PMs play a critical role in defining both technical and business strategy, and software delivery at scale.

Working closely with the other members of the Simcenter SaaS team, you will own the definition, execution, and delivery of the Simcenter SaaS platform. Your responsibilities include working with customers to identify requirements and defining product features as well as collaborating with the development teams to deliver innovative simulation workflows. The role will also require close collaboration with teams at Siemens developing SaaS solutions for Computer Aided Design (CAD), Product Lifecycle Management (PLM) and collaborative data management.

We are looking for someone that is customer-centric and enjoys working with engineers to understand and solve customer problems and build innovative solutions. Successful applicants will have experience defining cloud products, leading cross-functional teams and communicating clearly and effectively to a range of internal and external stakeholders.





What you’ll bring:






BS or BA in science or engineering

4+ years of Technical Product Management experience in a software development business

Proven experience in delivering cloud products and services

Highly motivated, able to show initiative and accountability within a dynamic work environment

An ability to find innovative approaches to problem solving and to show initiative in overcoming challenges

Experience in creating product vision and strategy, including understanding the market, target personas, and problems they face

Demonstrated strong interpersonal and communication skills and the ability to lead cross-functional teams, regardless of reporting structure

A strong team player and creative thinker who can work with multi-cultural, dispersed technical teams






Preferred Qualifications:






MBA or equivalent master's degree

Solid understanding of simulation and Computer Aided Engineering (CAE)

4+ years of Product Management experience in cloud computing technology






Join our Digital World!





We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, sex, gender, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

We offer a comprehensive reward package which includes a competitive basic salary, bonus scheme, generous holiday allowance, pension, private healthcare and actively support working from home.

We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform crucial job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.





Mentorship and Career Growth





Our expanding team of Simcenter Product Managers have a mix of experience in both cloud and simulation and are committed to mentoring and onboarding new team members. Continuous learning is a key part of our culture, with learning days for the entire organization several times a year. At Siemens we encourage everyone to own their career and enable Product Managers to take on more complex products and services over time.





Team Culture 





We have a strong emphasis on balancing life and work with individual autonomy. The position is open to applicants either in Europe or the Americas, where most of the SaaS platform team are located. At Siemens you will be working with employees spread around the globe, we celebrate the diversity that different cultures bring to our organization.

At Siemens, we are always challenging ourselves to build a better future. We have some of the smartest minds working across the world, re-imagining the future and doing outstanding things. 

Join our Talent Community today and let's stay connected in areas that interest you: https://new.siemens.com/global/en/company/jobs/digital-minds.html

company: MD Financial Management | Gestion financière MD
description:
Requisition ID:
 138637


Cost Centre
: MD Financial Mgmt Inc


Employee Referral Program – Potential Reward:
 $2,000.00

We are committed to investing in our employees and helping you continue your career at Scotiabank.

At MD Financial Management (MD), we believe health and wellness are life’s most valuable assets. For more than 50 years, we’ve dedicated our business to Canada’s physicians and their families, because we understand that financial well-being plays a lead role in building healthier lives. If you are a results-driven, enthusiastic and technology-savvy team player, you’ll thrive in our dynamic, flexible and collaborative environment. We are always looking for individuals with bright minds and a deep-seated desire to make a difference in the lives of some of the most hard-working, industrious and essential individuals in our community: Canada’s physicians.



What You Will Do



Reporting to the Senior Manager, Product Management, Client Applications, the Product Manager role intersects business, technology and the client user experience. Your efforts will center on the optimization of our products to achieve strategic, enterprise goals while concurrently maximizing the client experience and return on investment. To meet this end, you will collaborate with business stakeholders in a leadership capacity, from Engineering, Sales, Marketing, and Finance to name a few, to elicit requirements which are coupled with enterprise goals and industry trends into an actionable product roadmap. With a clear focus on the future of the product, the product manager works very closely with developers to help design and develop technology solutions that enhance MDFM’s value proposition to its clients. You are responsible for guiding products throughout the execution cycle, understanding the technology stack and its implementation processes at a level that supports sound decision making.



Specific Accountabilities




Set the strategic roadmap of assigned products based on alignment to corporate goals and the advancement of the client experience

Creation and ownership of a prioritized product backlog of the most important new features, refactoring of existing features and backlogged defects

Monitor industry trends and where applicable bring them into the product backlog

Expert in applicable wealth management practices and/or operational processes and seek out opportunities for process improvements that could be facilitated by system enhancements

Coordinate stakeholder input to elicit feedback for product enhancements to bring into the product backlog

Collaborate with stakeholders to breakdown larger projects into more granular, prioritized components that may be released individually

Work with stakeholders and team to articulate business requirements to support development, QA and change management activities for new product feature implementation

Coordinate with other delivery teams including but not limited to Release Management, PMO, Enterprise Architecture, Software Development, QA, Deployment Management, Security and Defect Management in the execution of projects or smaller release vehicles

Work closely with the application development and the quality assurance team members during all stages of the system development life cycle and bridge the gap between business and technology sides of the solution

Manage direct reports including performance management, hiring, succession planning, career development and compensation planning as required

Coordinate and assist users during user acceptance testing cycle where required

Act in the vendor prime role supported by the Vendor Management Team or act as second chair in vendor management discussions where vendor prime is held by the Vendor Management Team as required

Set and manage applicable vendor licensing or support charges per SLA with support from MD Vendor, Finance and Legal teams

Maintain a broad knowledge base of the products that support MD’s business especially those that are advisor or operations supporting

Monitor and/or identify trends in support calls and reported issues to assist in vendor escalation and/or product refactoring to feed into the product backlog




What You Need




A University degree with a business, engineering or computer science focus, or equivalent educational/professional experience and/or qualifications

8 years of prior relevant experience including a minimum of 3-5 years managing a team

Experience working on large program/project initiatives with technology and/or technology components

Prior experience in Financial Services an asset

Business Analyst/Process Analyst experience is an asset

Software development experience is an asset

User Interface design expertise is an asset




What You Bring




Analytical skills

Change agent

Client experience-focused

Confident communicator

Flexibility and works well independently

Ability to understand impacts/links between projects, teams

Tenacity and passion

Driven and ability to multi-task


Location(s): Canada : Ontario : Ottawa

Scotiabank is a leading bank in the Americas. Guided by our purpose: "for every future", we help our customers, their families and their communities achieve success through a broad range of advice, products and services, including personal and commercial banking, wealth management and private banking, corporate and investment banking, and capital markets.

At Scotiabank, we value the unique skills and experiences each individual brings to the Bank, and are committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible environment for everyone. If you require accommodation (including, but not limited to, an accessible interview site, alternate format documents, ASL Interpreter, or Assistive Technology) during the recruitment and selection process, please let our Recruitment team know. If you require technical assistance, please click here. Candidates must apply directly online to be considered for this role. We thank all applicants for their interest in a career at Scotiabank; however, only those candidates who are selected for an interview will be contacted.

Note: All postings in me@Scotiabank will remain live for a minimum of 5 days.

job_title: Concepteur d’architecture de cybersécurité - les solutions pré-vente
description:
526734BR


Introduction


Chez IBM, les concepteurs d'architecture de solutions travaillent à comprendre les besoins puis à créer des solutions complexes et de haute qualité qui ont des répercussions importantes. Vous serez responsable de la direction générale et de la prestation des solutions, du besoin e la mise en œuvre. Vous utiliserez vos connaissances approfondies des produits et des technologies de pointe ainsi que vos compétences en matière industrielles et commerciales pour influencer les résultats.

Votre rôle et vos responsabilités

En tant que concepteur d’architecture de sécurité d’IBM, vous assumez l’ensemble du leadership technique et des responsabilités lié à l’exécution des tâches suivantes : concevoir des solutions qui tirent profit des capacités du portefeuille de Sécurité IBM et génèrent des revenus liés aux ventes de logiciels et de logiciels sous forme de services. Les concepteurs exercent des fonctions de direction des activités techniques pendant le cycle de ventes, définissent une vision pour les clients, dirigent la collecte des exigences et l’analyse, conçoivent des solutions, animent les démonstrations et présentations et font partie intégrante d’une équipe des ventes axée sur le succès des clients.

Il s’agit d’un poste de haute direction en matière de ventes techniques. Il s’agit de fonctions où le titulaire est en contact avec la clientèle. Le candidat doit donc posséder le niveau de confiance et d’aisance qu’il faut pour travailler avec des cadres de secteur d’activité et collaborer efficacement avec les équipes des ventes et les partenaires commerciaux IBM.


Compétences Recherchées


Méthodologies et outils de conception d’architecture - capacité de faire appel aux notions de conception d’architecture et une certaine connaissance des méthodes et outils utilisés en conception de solution, évaluation du risque, etc.

Principes de gestion de la sécurité informatique – Très bonne compréhension des technologies de cybersécurité et expérience du développement de l’architecture de cybersécurité pour des clients de différents secteurs. Compréhension fondamentale des principes de gestion de la sécurité informatique, bonne compréhension de la résolution d’incidents informatiques, de la reprise après sinistre, du contrôle d’accès, de l’authentification, de l’audit, de la gouvernance, de la gestion du risque, de l’architecture de sécurité, de la cryptographie, du développement des systèmes et de la continuité des opérations.

Systèmes de TI - compréhension fondamentale des systèmes et des services de TI, ce qui comprend la virtualisation, les grands systèmes, les services infonuagiques, les services d’hébergement, les ordinateurs de bureau, etc.

Développement des systèmes - Compréhension fondamentale du développement

des systèmes de TI.

Technologies réseautiques - Compréhension des notions fondamentales des technologies réseautiques des TI, des constituants de base qui sont utilisés et de leur manière de favoriser la sécurité de l’architecture.

Autres compétences recherchées : Capacité de présenter le matériel et d’assurer le dialogue entre les cadres et le personnel technique; expérience de l’élaboration de soumissions, de présentations techniques, et de diagrammes d’architecture; expérience des tâches de soutien/conseils aux ventes et de vente de solutions; capacité de diriger une équipe.

Emplacement


Principales Responsabilités




 Promouvoir la valeur d’IBM par des discussions et ateliers en matière d’architecture.

 Mener des évaluations de la valeur en matière de sécurité, préparer des rapports et présenter leurs conclusions et recommandations.

 Définir la stratégie technique relative à des occasions commerciales.

 Diriger la collecte et l’analyse des exigences.

 Concevoir des solutions de sécurité en faisant appel aux capacités de Sécurité IBM.

 Donner des présentations à l’intention de clients et participer à des discussions de tableau blanc.

 Faire partie intégrante d’une équipe des ventes.

 Être responsable d’importantes relations de direction.

 Favoriser le succès des clients en matière de sécurité.



Les candidats retenus pour un poste à Montréal, QC, doivent être parfaitement bilingues en anglais et en français.

IBMReferred_NorthAmerica

Expertise professionnelle et technique requise



Le candidat doit être bilingue (anglais et français).

La désignation CISSP ou la désignation de sécurité sont d’importants atouts.

La compréhension des technologies IBM est un atout.

Haut niveau de compétence technique.

Capacité de bien travailler en équipe.

Goût de la résolution de problèmes et des solutions d’architecture.

Leader ayant d’excellentes habiletés en matière de présentation.



Expertise professionnelle et technique privilégié

Doit avoir la capacité de travailler au Canada sans parrainage.

A propos de l'unité commerciale

Alimentée par les technologies cognitives, plus de 150 offres SaaS, et des aperçus en temps réel, l'équipe des marchés mondiaux offre une expertise intégrée afin d'aider nos clients à prendre de meilleures décisions et à innover tout en collaborant avec leurs clients, partenaires et fournisseurs. Rejoignez-nous afin de continuer à stimuler l'innovation avec le portefeuille le plus complet pour les entreprises de tous les secteurs d'activité.

Votre vie chez IBM

Envie d'en savoir plus? Prêt à résoudre certains des défis parmi les plus uniques au monde? Et prêt à façonner l'avenir de millions de personnes?

Si c'est le cas, il est alors temps de vous joindre à nous, d'exprimer votre individualité, de laisser le champ libre à votre curiosité et d'explorer de nouvelles possibilités.

Chaque IBMiste (ou IBMiste potentiel comme vous) dispose d'une voix, trace son propre chemin et propose son expertise en vue d'aider à cocréer et à enrichir notre histoire. Ensemble, nous avons le pouvoir d'apporter des changements significatifs, de modifier la structure de nos clients, de la société et d'IBM elle-même, d'avoir un effet vraiment positif et de faire de ce monde un meilleur endroit pour tous.

Le moment est venu de définir votre carrière.

À propos d'IBM

La plus grande invention d'IBM, c'est l'IBMiste. Nous sommes convaincus que la mise en application de l'intelligence, de la raison et de la science nous permet d'améliorer l'activité économique, la société et la condition humaine, en donnant vie à la puissance d'un nuage hybride ouvert et d'une stratégie d'IA pour nos clients et nos partenaires du monde entier.

Ayant réinventé sans relâche depuis 1911, nous ne sommes pas seulement l'une des plus grandes entreprises au monde, nous sommes aussi l'un des plus grands employeurs en TI et en services-conseils, avec de nombreuses entreprises du classement Fortune 50 s'appuyant sur IBM Cloud pour gérer leur entreprise.

Chez IBM, nous sommes fiers d'avoir été parmi les premiers à adopter l'intelligence artificielle, l'informatique quantique et la chaîne de blocs. C'est le moment de vous joindre à nous et de devenir un innovateur technologique responsable et une force au service du bien dans le monde.

Énoncé du lieu de travail

Pour obtenir de l’information supplémentaire sur les critères d’emplacement, veuillez contacter le recruteur après avoir soumis votre demande.

Vous et IBM

IBM s'engage à créer un milieu diversifié et est fière de souscrire au principe de l'égalité d'accès à l'emploi. Tous les candidats qualifiés seront pris en considération pour un emploi sans égard à la race, à la couleur, à la religion, ausexe, à l'identité ou à l'expression de genre, à l'orientation sexuelle, à l'origine nationale, à la génétique, à la grossesse, aux handicaps, à l'âge, au statut de vétéran ou à d'autres caractéristiques. IBM s'engage également à se conformer à toutes lespratiques équitables en matière d'emploi à l'égard du statut de citoyen et d'immigrant.

industries: Food and Beverage Services, Manufacturing, and Retail
description:
Description




Position at Jackson Family Wines


Jackson Family Wines (JFW) is a leading family-owned wine company headquartered in Santa Rosa, California. We are risk-taking innovators with a strong belief that quality is paramount. We are always on the lookout for top talent —people who share a strong work ethic and a commitment to quality and who share our beliefs in healthy lands and a healthy community.



Position Summary



This position is responsible for working with our network of agents and their respective sales teams across Quebec and the Atlantic Provinces, forging relationships with both Liquor Board and On-Premise customers. The District Manager role is expected to inspire, educate, and set expectations with our agent partners for growth and success.



Essential Duties/Responsibilities




 Call on all key accounts within Quebec and the Atlantic Provinces. Accounts may include on-premise, off-premise, and hotel. Key Accounts determined by JFW management, agent partners and the JFW DM.

 Work with agency sales personnel to achieve sales goals. Goals may include new placements, revenue, case shipment and depletions goals.

 Monitor Importation Privee/Private Stock inventory levels and execute sales goals.

 Develop and continue to build relationships with our various agent partners.

 Provide weekly and monthly reports on supporting activities to JFW Manager.

 Perform quarterly and annual business reviews with both JFW Management and agent partners.

 Provide educational wine training to agent partners and key accounts through tastings and special events.

 Construct unique and engaging wine presentations and sales tools that embrace JFW company standards, programs, and initiatives.

 Ability to make persuasive sales calls using wine knowledge, ROI, margins and pour costs.

 Create, prioritize, and manage your own territory of key JFW accounts.

 Communicate pertinent information between JFW Management, Agent Management and Key Accounts.

 Responsible for managing and working within approved expense budget.

 Ability to effectively present one-on-one or in a group setting.

 Continue to develop wine knowledge, business acumen and sales skills to increase professional growth.

 Display original thinking and creativity for problem solving.

 Ability to work in a fast-paced environment, adapt and respond to change quickly.

 Other duties as assigned by JFW Manager.




Job Requirements




 Candidate must have a college degree and/or equivalent work experience with a minimum of 5 years successful wine and alcoholic beverage sales experience

 Familiarity with Liquor boards and key on-premise customers

 Fluent in French, both spoken and written

 Great communication and organizational skills

 Must possess a current driver’s license, maintain current auto insurance coverage, and a clean driving record

 Ability to lift 50 lbs. case of wine

 This position requires the availability and willingness to work flexible hours and weekends, when necessary

 Candidate must be prepared to reside within territory


Jackson Family Wines (JFW) est une entreprise viticole de familiale, historiquement basée à Santa Rosa, en Californie. Nous innovons en prenant des risques avec une forte conviction que la qualité est primordiale. Nous sommes constamment à la recherche de talents - de personnes partageant une éthique de travail solide, un engagement envers la qualité et nos convictions de terres saines et d’une communauté saine.



Résumé De La Position



Cette personne sera chargée de travailler en collaboration avec notre réseau d'agents et leurs équipes de vente respectives à travers le Québec et les provinces de l'Atlantique, en nouant des relations avec les clients de la Société des Alcools du Québec (SAQ) et des clients licenciés. Le rôle de Responsable de Territoire est d’inspirer, d’éduquer et de définir les attentes envers nos agents partenaires en matière de croissance et de succès.



Tâches Essentielles / Responsabilités




 Faire appel à tous les comptes clés du Québec et des provinces de l'Atlantique. Les comptes peuvent inclure des détaillants et clients licenciés; restaurants et hôtels. Les Comptes clés seront déterminés par la gestion de JFW, les agents partenaires, et JFW DM.

 Travailler avec le personnel de ventes de l'agence pour atteindre les objectifs. Les objectifs peuvent inclure des nouveaux placements, les revenus, l’acheminement de caisses et gestion des stocks.

 Gérez les niveaux d’inventaire d’Importations Privées et les objectifs d’exécution des ventes IP.

 Développer et continuer à tisser des liens avec nos différents agents partenaires.

 Fournir des rapports hebdomadaires et mensuels sur les activités en appui au responsable de JFW.

 Réaliser des revues commerciales trimestrielles et annuelles avec la gestion de JFW et ses partenaires.

 Offrir une formation viticole éducative aux agents partenaires et aux comptes clés lors de dégustations et d'événements spéciaux.

 Construire des présentations uniques et engageantes sur les vins et des outils de vente qui respectent les normes, programmes et initiatives de JFW.

 Aptitude à faire des appels de vente convaincants en utilisant la connaissance produit, le retour sur investissement, les marges et les coûts.

 Créer, hiérarchiser et gérer votre propre territoire de comptes clés.

 Communiquer les informations pertinentes entre la gestion JFW, ses partenaires, et les comptes clés.

 Gérer le travail dans les limites du budget de dépenses approuvées.

 Capacité à animer efficacement en face à face ou devant un groupe.

 Développer en continu la connaissance du vin, le sens des affaires et les compétences en vente afin d’améliorer la croissance professionnelle.

 Afficher une pensée originale et créative pour résoudre les problèmes.

 Capacité à travailler dans un environnement en évolution rapide, à s'adapter et à réagir rapidement aux changements.

 Autres tâches connexes assignées par le responsable JFW.




Exigences De L'emploi




 Le candidat doit avoir un diplôme universitaire et / ou une expérience de travail équivalente avec au moins 5 ans d'expérience réussie dans la vente de vin et de boissons alcoolisées.

 Familiarité avec les Monopoles d’état/Société des Alcools et les principaux clients licenciés

 Forte connaissance du français, parlé et écrit

 Excellentes compétences en communication et sens de l’organisation

 Posséder un permis de conduire valide, une couverture d’assurance-automobile et un dossier de conduite intact.

 Capacité à soulever une caisse de vin (50 lbs)

 Ce poste exige la disponibilité et la volonté à travailler selon des horaires flexibles, et ainsi que certaines fins de semaines au besoin

 Le candidat doit être prêt à résider sur le territoire

What You'll Do...

industries: IT Services and IT Consulting, Software Development, and Internet Publishing
description:
Job Summary




DESCRIPTION


Imagine being a part of a team where your ideas have the potential to change companies, reshape industries, and improve the lives of many. Picture working with cutting-edge technology, the most dynamic businesses, and a talented & inclusive team. Envision being able to leverage the resources of a Fortune-10 company within the atmosphere of a start-up. Welcome to Amazon Web Services where you can have fun while making history. Come and help build the future with us as a Solutions Architect.

As a Senior Solutions Architect, you will partner with customers, sales, and several other teams to craft highly flexible, and resilient architectures that address customer business problems and accelerate the adoption of services. In collaboration with sales, you will help drive revenue growth across a broad set of customers. As a trusted customer advocate, you will help organizations understand best practices around advanced-based solutions. You will seek out opportunity to help shape and execute a strategy to build mindshare and broaden the use of the platform across customer organizations. You will utilize your ability to think strategically about business, products, and technical challenges.

As an Senior Solutions Architect you are joining a team that invests in your success by providing comprehensive learning and mentorship programs. The Solutions Architecture team provides an opportunity to work in an open environment that includes self-paced learning, instructor-led training, hands-on projects, and job shadowing opportunities to develop your knowledge of the ecosystem of services and solutions. You will bring a curious mind, a thirst for knowledge, and a desire to understand how technology works. By working backwards from defined customer outcomes, you will achieve results that delight customers. You enjoy keeping your existing technical skills honed and developing new ones so you can make meaningful contributions to long-term customer success.

Key job responsibilities


 Build deep relationships with customers to become a trusted advisor for their most critical workloads that support their digital transformation and journey to the cloud

 Support achievement of revenue objectives through the adoption and migration of applications, software, and services onto the platform in partnership with the sales team

 Educate customers on the value proposition of cloud and participate in deep architectural discussions to ensure solutions are designed for successful deployment

 Contribute to internal and customer-facing publications such as white-papers and blogs as a means of scaling your knowledge

 Act as a liaison between customers, service engineering teams, and support to address customer needs


Travel requirements


 All travel is temporarily on hold.




About The Team



we are open to candidates being located across Canada in Toronto, Calgary or Vancouver.




Basic Qualifications




 Bachelor's degree in computer science, engineering, mathematics, or related field of study OR 8+ years of professional or military work experience

 5+ years within specific technology domain areas (e.g. software development, cloud computing, systems engineering, infrastructure, security, networking, data & analytics)

 3+ years of design, implementation, or consulting experience in applications and infrastructures

 Experience communicating across technical and non-technical audiences, including executive level stakeholders or clients

 4 years in a technical solutions role, designing, implementing applications, databases, and networks.




Preferred Qualifications




 Experience architecting/operating solutions built on AWS

 Presentation skills with a high degree of comfort speaking with executives, IT managers, and developers

 Hands-on scripting experience (e.g. , Perl, JavaScript, JQuery, etc.)

 Technical degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics equivalent work experience.


Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, or other legally protected status. If you would like to request an accommodation, please notify your Recruiter.



Company
 - Amazon Web Services Canada, In

Reporting to the Field Sales Director British Columbia, the Territory Manager, Spirits is responsible for the implementation of the territorial sales plan to maximize sales volume and product distribution of the Dandurand Group Spirits Portfolio.





Responsibilities



Establish a sales cycle for 50 plus Retail outlets, and 50 plus Top Spirits Accounts in the On-Trade Channel

Focus on Distribution of New Products and Key focus brands in the Retail Channel

Aggressively grow market share and presence in the Licensee Channel by building quality partnerships that fit our portfolio.

Analyze industry data and be able to interpret to build quality sales presentations, with a focus on strong ROI

Proactively identify and engage in opportunities to grow business, add value and keep our brands top of mind

100% compliance in tracking account calls, targets, objectives, distribution and account management in CRM platform
