industries: Non-profit Organizations, Recreational Facilities, and Business Consulting and Services
description:
ATVBC General Manager, Contract





Summit Search Group in conjunction with The Quad Riders ATV Association of British Columbia (ATVBC) is seeking an experienced and innovative individual to guide and manage the organization through the next stages of its evolution as the non-profit provincial umbrella organization for more than forty clubs and 5,000 members.




Similar to an Executive director, the General Manager, opportunity is a work-from-home contract position is only geographically limited to British Columbia. 
ATVBC anticipates the individual would be available to ATVBC 16 days per month (consisting of whole or partial days) 
with a potential for increases as the individual contributes to the growth of this organization.




The ideal candidate will be knowledgeable in all aspects of recreational ATV’ing, or related off-road motorized sports, ranging from access management to wildlife. Particular emphasis on land use conflict resolution and experience in dealing with regulators is preferred.




As ATVBC evolves, there is considerable flexibility to craft this position to optimize the mix of interests, skills and experience that the successful candidate will bring to the job. We are interested in discussing your vision for how recreational ATV riding should grow in the province and what ATVBC’s, and your, roles should be.





 



Character and Extent of Services





The primary goal of ATVBC is to enhance ATV off highway motorized recreation, with a particular emphasis on safety and environmental responsibility. Therefore, under the general direction of ATVBC, and within the scope of ATVBC’s operating policies and procedures, the successful candidate will meet the goals and objectives of ATVBC by providing management services and expertise as and when needed to ATVBC, associated clubs and its members as follows:





Land And Environmental Issues Directly Related to Motorized ATV/OHV Sports


The successful candidate will:




1. Be the public voice of responsible All Terrain Vehicle owners and operators in British Columbia.




2. Provide an effective two-way communications link to Governments and the various ministries
 
to influence and/or achieve the goals of ATVBC.




3. Liaise with all levels of Government both locally and provincially in the implementation of initiatives and agreements including negotiations for the benefit of ATVBC.




4. Liaise and work with other user groups within the province in the negotiation and/or implementation of any agreements, the achievement of mutual goals and objectives, and/or to resolve any real or perceived conflict.




5. Participate in provincial and local initiatives that can and/or will affect the goals of ATVBC and the motorized trails community.




6. Upon request of the member clubs, and with the approval and/or involvement of ATVBC, provide advice, planning, assistance and implementation of local trail programs and assist in the resolution of land use issues and resource management decisions on both Crown and private lands.




7. Participate in the liaison and development of a unified front for all ATV/OHV sports in working with the government.




8. Continue in the development, implementation and/or participation in any of the following major projects:




i. Provincial initiatives that are designed to improve or are for the benefit of the sport;

ii. Continue in the development and implementation of a tourism program that will enhance ATV/OHV sports.




9. Provide advice on, and implement any other programmes not listed that further the goals and objectives of the sport and are within the scope of environmental and/or land use issues as they affect recreational ATV/OHV use.


 



Management Services Related to ATVBC’s Operation



 


The successful candidate will:




1. In conjunction with the Board of Directors, and more specifically the President, oversee the general direction of ATVBC.




2. Make recommendations to ATVBC in the development of policies and provide advice regarding proposed strategic plans, proposed new programs, or new directions of ATVBC.




3. Work with the ATVBC Board of Directors to prepare an annual budget.




4. Assist, as and when needed, in the identification, preparation, writing and subsequent progress reports of grant applications that will contribute to ATVBC and its goals.




5. Assist with fundraising, promoting membership, and providing strong communications with members, stakeholders and sponsors.




6. Seek new funding sources that are compatible with the strategic direction of ATVBC.




7. Provide input to the Trails/Environment/Land Use, Finance, and Insurance Committees, and other committees from time to time.




8. Provide brief monthly summaries of activities to the Board of Directors.




9. Participate in monthly online Directors’ meetings, online Club Presidents’ meetings, and 
ad hoc
 committee meetings as needed.




10. Arrange and participate in two annual in-person Directors’ meetings and one in-person general membership meeting at locations to be determined by the Board.




11. Other activities that fit within the intent and scope of this agreement and its priorities that are requested by motion of the Board of Directors through the President.





Qualifications



 


As General Manager the successful candidate:


 


1. Willingness to register and maintain registration, in good standing, as a consultant lobbyist representing the interests of ATVBC.




2. Will be able to demonstrate and provide examples where they have been successful as a lobbyist.




3. Will have the appropriate management experience that will enable them to interact with senior levels of government and other organisations within the province.




4. Should be experienced with, and have knowledge of, current BC Land Management regulations, polices and procedures and the Off-Road VehicleAct.




5. Should be familiar with the BC government’s sustainable resource management plans.




6. Must be willing and available to travel, on a limited basis, throughout the province and across the country as needed.




7. Have demonstrated previous supervisory experience.




8. Will take direction from the Board through the President and provide supervision and direction to the office manager and other staff.




9. Familiar with governance in non-profit organisations.




10. Will be responsible for the general day to day operations of ATVBC.




11. Ideally, has a passion for the sport and is/has been an ORV rider and belongs to, or has belonged to, one or more of the clubs in BC.

Job Role: 
Customer Success Manager (Bilingual)


Location: 
Toronto, Canada 





Who we are


Ezra delivers the highest quality professional coaching to employees using industry leading app-based technology. We redesigned coaching for the digital age with world class technology enabling quality coaching sessions, a seamless user journey and regular reporting like never before.

With 50+ years’ experience delivering world class coaching in 66 countries we’re best placed to drive the coaching revolution. In just over a year, we have grown to become the fastest growing virtual coaching solution globally, supporting many of the world's leading companies with high impact, 1:1 personalised coaching. 

At Ezra we use innovative technology to achieve the greatest user experience, but the heart of the service is the quality and diversity of our 2000+ global coaching pool. 

Now, everyone can be better with a coach.





The Role


To aid our rapidly expanding growth, we are looking for a pro-active, energizing Customer Success Manager to oversee and manage the end to end customer delivery experience from implementation, to launch and customer reporting.

 

This is an exciting role with significant stretch opportunity, with the individual expected to play a critical role in Ezra’s current and future growth. 


 






What you’ll do



Key Accountabilities:



 Provide effective and proactive first-level service to our customer program stakeholders

 Project manage the client onboarding set-up, from contract close to launch date, collaborating with key functions that play a role in the implementation process

 Effectively communicate with cross functional departments that support the overall customer and participant experience: Sales, Solutions Leads, Coaching Services, Participant Care, Impact Labs, Product and Finance. 

 Oversee all reporting requirements at account level during the Ezra Program across individual and multiple programs run by a client

 Key day to day relationship contact for our client stakeholders during the delivery phase






Key Activities



Customer implementation and launch



 Develop a complete understanding of the contract and customer program requirements to ensure ease of a successful implementation

 Coordination and attendance at client onboarding meetings to define key milestones and communications in partnership with the Account Manager

 Modify and develop communication toolkit items to promote a solid understanding of Ezra by all customer stakeholders 

 Partner with the Impact Labs Team for the set-up of development goals and Ezra’s 180 diagnostic tool

 Coordinate with our Coaching Solutions team to identify and onboard the relevant coaches based on the client’s objectives, needs and program reach

 Facilitate coach and participant awareness sessions in the lead up to a new program launch

 Oversee and coordinate regular adoption and engagement follow ups via the participant care team to maximise take-up in line with business SLAs

 Partner with participant care team to ensure a best in class end user experience

 Coordinate reporting requirements via Ezra’s customer portal

 Facilitate and seek out methods to capture key program insights and themes that demonstrate the impact of Ezra coaching

 Proactively plan and prepare for client review meetings, compiling account reporting including PowerPoint presentations and data analysis to provide data insights and trends with wider Ezra Team stakeholders



Systems and Knowledge Management



 Daily use of Ezra project management tool to ensure the timely implementation of new programs

 Microsoft Office Suite including PowerBI and PowerAutomate

 Stay well-versed in and be able to explain and articulate Ezra’s Product and Platform capabilities



 



 



Collaboration



 Develop, foster and maintain client relationships to ensure account retention in partnership with sales

 Help Ezra evolve existing and new processes that will enhance the client and participant experience


 





About you 



 2 – 4 years of experience as a project manager with proven experience in a customer facing role

 Ability to build trust and relationships quickly

 Strong communicator on a one-on-one basis and presenter to larger audiences 

 Willingness to work in a fast-paced start-up environment and comfort around operating with an element of ambiguity 

 Critical thinking skills: ability to problem solve independently and quickly 

 Confident, accurate and clear communicator

 Self-starter able to operate in a high pressure, deadline driven, virtual environment

 Ability to influence others without direct authority and, at times, challenge the status quo

 Proficiency in MS Office Suite 

 Passionate about clients and participants needs

Fluency in Spanish and/or Portuguese


 

 




We are an equal opportunity employer dedicated to having a thriving, diverse team where everyone has a voice and feels able to be themselves. We believe that through valuing our uniqueness and respecting our differences, we can achieve more, and that diversity adds to our culture. Attracting and developing a diverse workforce that reflects the communities in which we serve is essential to us.

job_title: Primary Care Representative – Nutrition (Montreal/Montérégie) / Représentant, soins primaires – Nutrition (Montréal/Montérégie)
description:
Abbott is a global healthcare leader that helps people live more fully at all stages of life. Our portfolio of life-changing technologies spans the spectrum of healthcare, with leading businesses and products in diagnostics, medical devices, nutritionals and branded generic medicines. Our 113,000 colleagues serve people in more than 160 countries.


Status
: Regular, Full Time


Territory
: Montreal/Montérégie



Position Overview



Primary Care Representatives are responsible for creating demand for Abbott Nutrition products and will be considered a strong team player despite working autonomously most of the time.

Under the supervision and coaching of the Regional Sales Manager (RSM), the Primary Care Representative will be responsible for sampling and detailing adult and pediatric products to community based HCP (GP’s, RN’s, RD’s).

Primary Care Representatives play a key role in ensuring customers are well-stocked with Abbott Nutrition samples and materials and that the customers understand how to use them.

This individual will have strong interpersonal skills and show an aptitude for quickly developing relationships and gaining access to customers. He/she will be adaptable from a scheduling perspective and be prepared to do what it takes to drive business objectives according to customer needs and availability.

Primary Care Representatives will possess strong territory management skills and will be expected to maintain records of sampling and selling activities in real time (use of Salesforce.com, pre-post call entries, maintenance of key HCP list, etc.).

He/she will be expected to write his/her territory business plan and ensure proper analysis of territory KPI’s while effectively using dashboards to analyze progress and determine next steps.



Required Education And Experience




Bachelor’s degree required in business, marketing or science – background in nutrition an asset.

1-3 years' experience in sales. This level normally corresponds to the requirements of an entry-level job that allows the employee to develop his skills in terms of various techniques and approaches to acquire practical experience for various aspects of the job.

Must be bilingual, French and English. 

Candidates must live within the vicinity of the territory.

This position requires extensive driving of a corporate car (supplied by Abbott) and maintenance of a valid driver’s license at all times.

Must be able to lift, carry and manage car stock and sample delivery to customers.

Job requires daily use of basic computer software like MS Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint) as well as Outlook and Salesforce.com.


Join Our Talent Community to learn about upcoming job opportunities or connect with us at Abbott Canada, on LinkedIn, on Facebook and on Twitter @AbbottNews and @Abbott Global.

____________________________________________________

Abbott est un chef de file mondial dans le domaine des soins de santé qui aide les gens à profiter pleinement de la vie, à chaque étape. Nous offrons des technologies révolutionnaires qui touchent l’ensemble des soins de santé, avec des unités commerciales dans les secteurs des produits diagnostiques, des appareils médicaux, des produits nutritionnels et des médicaments génériques de marque. Nos 113 000 employés répondent aux besoins de la population dans plus de 160 pays.


Statut : 
Régulier, temps plein


Territoire : 
Montreal/Montérégie



Aperçu Du Poste



Le Représentant, soins primaires, est responsable de générer de la demande pour les produits d’Abbott Nutrition et sera considéré comme un membre important de l’équipe, malgré le fait qu’il travaille de façon autonome la plupart du temps.

Supervisé et encadré par le Chef régional des ventes, le Représentant, soins primaires, sera responsable de présenter les produits pour adultes et pour enfants aux professionnels de la santé qui travaillent en milieu communautaire (omnipraticiens, infirmières, diététistes) et de leur remettre des échantillons de ces produits.

Le Représentant, soins primaires, devra s’assurer que les clients ont suffisamment d’échantillons de produits et de matériel d’Abbott Nutrition et comprennent bien comment les utiliser.

Il doit posséder d’excellentes aptitudes pour les relations interpersonnelles et être capable d’établir rapidement des relations et d’obtenir l’accès aux clients. Il doit pouvoir adapter son horaire et être prêt à faire ce qu’il faut pour soutenir les objectifs de l’entreprise, en fonction des besoins et de la disponibilité des clients.

Le Représentant, soins primaires, doit posséder de solides compétences en gestion de territoire et devra tenir à jour des registres sur les échantillons remis et les activités de vente en temps réel (utilisation de salesforce.com, entrées de données avant et après les visites, tenue d’une liste des professionnels de la santé clés, etc.).

Le titulaire du poste devra rédiger son plan d’affaires pour le territoire et bien analyser les indicateurs de rendement clés de son territoire, tout en utilisant efficacement les tableaux de bord pour analyser les progrès réalisés et déterminer les prochaines mesures à prendre.



Éducation Et Expérience Requise




Baccalauréat, ou diplôme équivalent, en administration des affaires, en marketing ou en sciences – études en nutrition, un atout.

De 1 à 3 années d’expérience en vente. Ce niveau correspond normalement aux exigences d’un poste de débutant, lequel permet à l’employé de développer ses connaissances en rapport aux diverses techniques et approches en vue d’acquérir de l’expérience pratique relativement aux divers aspects de l’emploi.

Bilingue, français et anglais. 

Les candidats doivent habiter dans les environs du territoire.

Ce poste requiert la conduite fréquente d’une voiture de fonction (fournie par Abbott) et le maintien d’un permis de conduire valide en tout temps.

Le poste requiert aussi de soulever et transporter des marchandises et de livrer des échantillons aux clients.

Enfin, le poste requiert l’utilisation quotidienne de logiciels de base, comme la suite MS Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint) ainsi qu’Outlook et Salesforce.com.


Joignez-vous à notre communauté de talents pour en apprendre davantage sur nos futures opportunités d'emploi ou communiquez avec nous sur Abbott Canada, sur LinkedIn, sur Facebook et sur Twitter @AbbottNews et @Abbott Global.

industries: IT Services and IT Consulting, Software Development, and Retail Office Equipment
description:
We want you to join our customer centric team whose passion it is to Empower Digital workplaces!

At Ricoh, we aren’t satisfied with keeping pace with today’s complex work environments, we are setting the pace. We are reimagining the workplace.

Our high-performance workplace is powered by a team that thrives. We offer a friendly culture with a focus on wellbeing and work life balance. Flexible work options, a time off purchase program, great physical and mental health benefits, employee discount and recognition programs are only some of the advantages of working at Ricoh.

We are a family that promotes positive manager relationships and on-going learning & development that nurtures professional growth and career advancement.

Discover what you are capable of in an environment where your growth is supported, and your success is celebrated.


Technical Solutions Architect, Communication Services


The Technical Solutions Architect (TSA) will act as a subject matter expert (SME) and technical expert leader for Communication Services (CS), work closely with the sales teams and will be responsible for solution demo, proof of concept, and pilot for Communication Services.

The TSA will be responsible for leading the delivery of technical presales including CS solutions architecture and CS solutions development for professional services, managed services and procurement opportunities.

The TSA will need to have a strong AV background as well as very good knowledge of IT technologies. You will also be required to provide consulting services such as scoping, design, migration, build and support to customers on CS based platforms and solutions until such time as Ricoh builds out the capability across the Consulting department.

The TSA will report into the National Sales Manager, Communication Services, under the daily supervision of the Team Lead, Communication Services Engineering.



Job Duties & Responsibilities




You will primarily support enterprise sales in the field by working directly with Ricoh CS Solution Consultants, Direct Sales representatives and their customers

Contribute technical and design input to the RFP and proposal creation process for CS products and services.

Support CS solutions pre-sales activities through sustained activities in presentations, solution prototype development, and demonstrations

Adhere to solutions engagement process to design Ricoh portfolio of Communication Services solutions by supporting professional services sales management, Sales Rep & customer workshops, vendor shows, etc. to promote Ricoh Communication Services capabilities

Support the CS sales teams as the subject matter expert during the presales process and drive to meet or exceed assigned revenue and target metric objectives within the assigned territory

Develops Statement of Work (SOW) and design documentation as a part of the business solution that relates to CS requirements

Adheres to and complies with the RICOH design methodology framework to hand-off solutions they designed directly to the Install and Project Management Office (PMO) team

Utilizes business tools such as Microsoft VISIO, Project, D-Tools and Service Now, to manage and deliver successful outcomes

Engages vendor partners to assist in complex solutions where appropriate

Performs other duties as assigned




Qualifications (Education, Experience, Certifications)




4-year university degree or equivalent business experience in a related field

5 to 10 years experience in AV Consultation, System Design and Project management

Experience designing complete CS solutions

Demonstrated knowledge in the use, applications, and design of systems. Ability to integrate various product categories to create a complete system solution

Knowledge of and a demonstrated track record developing successful design and deployment of AV products, unified communications, and business applications

Knowledge & proficiency in enterprise IT environments, including: Microsoft, Cisco, networking, etc.

Good knowledge of enterprise network & IT security practices

CTS-D certification is a plus, or equivalent AV knowledge and experience

One of the following certifications is a plus: Microsoft Certified Solutions Expert, Certified Information Systems Security Professional (CISSP), ITIL® v3 Foundation, Cisco Certified Networking Professional (CCNP) Routing & Switching, Certified Information Systems Auditor (CISA)




Knowledge, Skills And Abilities




Excellent planning and organizational skills

Exceptional multi-tasking and time management skills

Ability to advance with new technology - learning aptitude and adjusts well to change;

Strong verbal and written communication skills, including ability to present to customers including C-Level and enterprise accounts.

Ability to create professional design documentation

Bilingualism (French / English) is a plus 




Other Requirements




Regular travel to customer and Ricoh locations throughout Canada (one week a month on average)

Occasional travel to Ricoh Canada head office or US locations

Valid driver's license and use of a reliable vehicle at all times (auto insurance coverage per Ricoh's policy)


Ricoh is an information management and digital services company connecting technology, processes, and people in progressive business around the world. Ricoh is a recognized leader in document workflow, process automation, digital transformation, and security. Every day our 90,000+ global employees work with big and small companies' optimizing their end-to-end business solutions.

industries: Retail Apparel and Fashion, Retail, and Retail Luxury Goods and Jewelry
description:
Join our team!

Become a Brand Ambassador!

We are looking for a talented Assistant Manager to join our team!

The Assistant Manager is the brand ambassador and customer service expert. Their key focus is Partner with the Store Manager to maximum sales and profits by leading and achieving financial and other measurable objectives, including sales goals; ensuring excellent customer experience is provided at all times through actions and behaviors; and by consistently maintaining all aspects of day to day operations of the store and people. Assistant Managers are expected to perform a variety of tasks that includes service, product placement, visual and operational execution.



As An Assistant Manager You Display Such Competencies As



Results-Oriented: Generating results through a collaborative partnership with the Store Manager. Enabling associates to work effectively with and through teams to achieve the results the business requires. Holds self and others accountable for achieving business objectives and goals.

Develop Brand Ambassadors: Actively works to improve the performance of oneself and others by pursuing opportunities for continuous learning and feedback; constructively helps and coaches others in their development of skills; exhibits a can-do approach and inspires associates to excel.

Teamwork / Engagement: Fosters the culture of teamwork. Operates with honesty and is transparent in actions, tasks, and expectations. Works well with all individuals to provide support, coaching, encouragement, direction, and feedback.



This Opportunity Might Be For You If You Are



You are passionate about the fashion industry and have 1 to 3 years of experience in management.

You thrive working in a fast-paced environment.

You have strong problem-solving skills and excel at relationship building.

You have the ability to coach others and prioritize and delegate tasks.

You are effective in the use of technology to enhance customer engagement and drive KPI results.

You have the ability to work a flexible schedule to meet the needs of the business - including nights, weekends, and holidays



What We Offer



A competitive compensation package.

A comprehensive benefits package for all full-time employees.

Employee discount at our companies.

About Our Client: 
Our client is a successful and well-recognized private staffing/recruitment firm headquartered in Toronto with a presence across in North America. Our client has extensive plans to continue to grow and expand their business cross North America over the next 10 years.

 

 


Position Scope: 
The Corporate Bilingual Talent Acquisition Specialist will source candidates on behalf of internal hiring managers (all internal talent acquisition). The successful candidate will be able to attract first-rate talent and to ensure lasting and successful placements internally – these roles span across sales, HR, client service, finance, etc. The Corporate Bilingual Talent Acquisition Specialist will build and extend hiring manager relationships through excellence in recruitment process delivery including sourcing, screening, assessing, and marketing candidates to key internal stakeholders in the organization. This role focuses on high touch candidate relationship management as well as customer focus and responsiveness to internal hiring managers. The Corporate Bilingual Talent Acquisition Specialist is the subject matter expert around applicant tracking systems, candidate sourcing methodologies and recruitment process effectiveness for the internal hiring process.


 



Responsibilities:


· Partner with the internal hiring managers and stakeholders to identify their strategic objectives for their hiring needs

· Identify & communicate continuous improvement opportunities and strategies for Talent Acquisition

· Conduct role briefing with the internal hiring manager and set expectations for recruitment process 

· Create and execute multi-channel sourcing strategy to source candidates meeting client profile and/or building talent pool for current and future requirements

· Apply and adapt broader talent acquisition strategies (employer branding, internal recruiting, diversity, etc.) 

· Investigate additional screening and testing methodologies on a role by role basis that could assist with identifying key competencies for the applicants.

· Leverage candidate databases (internal and external) in addition to other sourcing channels (university, competitive research, job fairs, social) to identify prospective candidates to create awareness and invite them to apply for open positions including cold calling prospects.

· Devise and carry out a targeted research strategy for all identified positions by evaluating competitors, similar companies and the marketplace to provide insights that may impact the hiring process

· Facilitate the creation of internal job descriptions alongside the hiring manager for new positions and review existing job descriptions prior to commencing search to validate the existing requirements including compensation are relevant to the current organizational standards

· Track and identify prospective candidates using a variety of channels

Assess candidates to ensure qualification match, cultural fit and compatibility with the organization and role. 

· Qualify candidates meet internal hiring requirements including background screening, testing and ability to provide supervisory references

· Source qualified candidates, interview and present shortlisted candidates with a detailed profile summary to hiring managers

· Offer guidance and facilitate the offer and negotiation process through to its completion

· Follow up with hiring managers and assist with the candidate’s transition and onboarding process

· Participate in Campus Recruitment and/or job fair requirements that may attract new graduates 

· Other duties as assigned

 


Required Skills and Knowledge:


· Deep understanding of corporate recruitment process 

· Extensive experience interacting with Hiring Managers throughout the recruitment process

· Experience developing and executing sourcing methodologies to include market mapping, recruitment strategies and Boolean searches

· Proficiency in using applicant tracking systems (Bullhorn), recruiting software and candidate databases

· Strong knowledge of candidate selection methods

· Previous experience with candidate sourcing tools and methods

· Excellent knowledge of area of expertise (market status, trends, best practices)

· Client focus along with relationship building skills

· Business acumen and market insight

· Effective negotiation, influencing and communication skills

· Integrity and confidentiality

· Fully bilingual in French and English

 


Education and Experience:


· Undergraduate degree or college diploma 

· Proven working experience in recruiting for a minimum of 5 years 

· The ideal candidate will have corporate recruitment experience 

 


Application Instructions: 


To apply, please send a resume to Aman Sodi at Aman.Sodi@summitsearchgroup.com


 



Summit Search Group is a fair and equitable search firm. We welcome and encourage applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the recruitment and selection process.

Join AutoTrader and shape the future of automotive e-commerce. We are on a mission to reinvent the digital retail experience for automotive consumers. Come to Trader and join a diverse workforce, working with the latest tech to pave the way for innovation.




We are proud to have built an environment where everyone has an opportunity to be their creative best. A place where we value collaboration, curiosity, and excellence. A place, where we trust teams to work autonomously, make data-driven decisions, and become masters of their craft through numerous learning opportunities.




Sounds like something you would enjoy?




We are looking for a Program Manager for the largest automotive marketplace in Canada.




The Program Manager position within the SBU Program Delivery Team will be instrumental in the continued growth and success of our technology platform (Digital Retailing, CRM, Advertising, Website, Inventory) for enterprise-scale customers (Automotive OEMs and Dealers). The Program Manager requires a self-driven approach with the ability to effectively collaborate and communicate across multi-functional teams including product, engineering, client operations, customer success, and support in order to successfully deliver a premium digital experience, through a connected retail software platform. The ideal individual is a highly effective critical thinker who is motivated by innovation and the challenge to build a program delivery center of excellence.


What you’ll do…



Lead, manage, and integrate day-to-day execution of complex, multi-dimensional program activities in accordance with contractual Statement of Work (SOW) requirements.

Create and maintain the project plans (blueprints) for software delivery projects, including scope definition, identification of tasks, resource allocation, key milestone setting, communication strategy, testing strategy, and release cadence.

Manage program governance of an assigned portfolio of projects which includes tracking billable milestones, producing internal/external status reports, and measuring overall project performance.

Own project status reporting within external client/internal meetings including reviewing action items, risk identification, and discussing opportunities to support change management activities.

Work closely with project sponsors at the senior leadership level to develop risk mitigation plans.

Contribute to the success of the Program Delivery Team by adding value to the development of best practices, standard operating procedures (SOP), and process improvements.

Provide post-release warranty period oversight and successfully execute the closure of the program.



Key Relationships:



Reports to Director of Program Delivery

Close collaboration with Product Managers, Director of Product Management, Director of Engineering, Director of OEM Sales, Director of OEM & Enterprise Client Services, Director of Client Operations



What you bring to the table…



8-10 years years of experience in a project manager role, or minimum of 5 years of experience in a program management role in a SaaS environment

Prior experience in the automotive industry, e-commerce, or with a digital agency would be an asset but is not required.

Extensive and proven experience with successfully delivering enterprise-scale web-based software build and implementation projects/programs in a fast-paced, collaborative environment.

Extensive experience working collaboratively with Product Management, UX/design, and engineering teams.

Familiar with the common technology stacks used for web-based software products that can be delivered as a service.

First-class influencing and change management skills.

Strong MS Office & Google Apps proficiency.

Expert proficiency in project management tools such as Atlassian (JIRA, Confluence, Trello), monday.com, Wrike, Trello, or Asana.

Advanced leadership skills and the ability to motivate team members in a cross-functional environment.

Strong oral and written communication skills proven by presenting complex delivery plans to colleagues and clients.

Impeccable attention to detail and strong organizational skills are an absolute must.

Self-starter that is comfortable working with minimal oversight and tight deadlines.

Possess a “do whatever it takes” attitude to get the job done. You are willing to “get your hands dirty”.

Ability to effectively collaborate across (virtual) teams, time zones, and cultures.

Ability to work and be flexible among changing priorities and timelines.



Education & training:



Bachelor’s degree in business, computer science, or related field.

Project management certification (PMP), change management certification (CCMP), or other project management training.

Pragmatic institute certification would be an asset but not required.



What’s in it for you…


We understand that there is life at work and life outside of work. Here are a few benefits we all benefit from that support us to be our creative best.


Fitness and wellness


We provide discounts to nationwide gyms, onsite gyms (when we’re in the office), an Employee and Family Assistance Programme, as well as a virtual wellness program.


Day 1 health benefits

Gym discounts

Local in-office free gyms

Employee and Family Assistance program

Weekly virtual wellness events



Learning allowance


In addition to in-house training, we provide an annual allowance of $1500 so you can grow your skills.


Tuition allowance

Conferences & training budget

Regular internal training programs



Financial planning


Let us help you invest in your future with a 3% matching towards your pension and multiple forms of income protection.


Competitive salary

Annual bonus structure

3% CPP matching

location: City of Langley, British Columbia, Canada
description:
General Responsibilities

Join the World's Largest Car Rental Company as a Branch Manager Trainee! As a Branch Manager Trainee, you are responsible for driving your own career, we just provide the fuel! Each year, many talented people join Hertz, and the best become future Branch Managers of our Hertz Local Edition branches.

Our program provides hands-on training in: sales, operations, customer service, finance & accounting management, revenue management, fleet management, and most importantly: people management.

Hertz rewards its employees with competitive compensation packages including: hourly pay, overtime pay, and performance based bonuses. Our successful training employees have the ability to earn over $45,000k a year upon achievement of all company goals. You will also receive the use of a company car upon entry into the Branch Manager ranks.

The Hertz program provides a clearly defined career path to a Branch Manager in as little as 1 year! Our promotions don't stop there; our top level management regularly comes from the Training ranks.

Your journey with Hertz will start off as a Branch Manager Trainee, quickly progressing into a Management Associate, while quickly gaining experience for a future Branch Manager role.

As a Branch Manager Trainee, you will be responsible for:


 Supporting achievement of location sales and margin goals

 Ensuring positive customer experience, making Hertz #1 in car rental company experience

 Achieving individual sales goals and customer service goals

 Growing sales utilizing business-to-business sales tactics

 Support branch's business plan by assisting the Branch Manager

 Upholding company standards by ensuring cars are presentable to customers

 Clean and service facilities to ensure customer satisfaction


In addition to our competitive compensation package, Hertz also provides world class benefits, which include:


 Medical, Dental, and Vision Insurance

 Life Insurance

 Up to 4 weeks of paid vacation a year (* depending on employment level)

 Hertz Pension Plan

 Employee Discounts

 Successful candidates will initially be employed in our Branch Manager training program as a Manager Trainee.

 Stagiaire en gestion

At Hertz, we champion and celebrate a culture of diversity and inclusion. We take affirmative steps to promote employment and advancement opportunities. The endless variety of perspectives, experiences, skills and talents that our employees invest in their work every day represent a significant part of our culture - and our success and reputation as a company.

Individuals are encouraged to apply for positions because of the characteristics that make them unique.

Qualified applicants with criminal histories will be considered for employment in a manner consistent with applicable federal, state and local law.

industries: Packaging and Containers Manufacturing and Industrial Machinery Manufacturing
description:
A service-driven paper and packaging products company, Atlantic Packaging has grown to become one of Canada’s largest paper manufacturers and a leading producer of packaging products; employing approximately 1200 people, at eight manufacturing plants and four distribution centers.




We are seeking a 
Customer Service Coordinator for 111 Progress, this will be a full time position





This individual will be responsible for supporting a few new Sales Account Executives assigned to Scarborough which has significantly expanded our customer base. The position reports directly to the Customer Service Manager for the East.

Preferred candidate should have 1-3 years of Customer Service and or Sales Administration experience related to Manufacturing or Distribution, Warehousing and Supply Chain





Customer Focus
 - Personally demonstrates that external and internal customers are a high priority. Identifies customer needs and expectations and responds to them in a timely and effective manner. Anticipates and prevents delays or other things that can adversely affect the customer. Keeps customers informed about the status of pending actions and audits customer satisfaction with products or services.


Decision Quality
 - Gathers enough information to allow a pragmatic assessment of risks and benefits of alternative approaches in any decision. Stays focused on objectives and considers both the short-term and longer-term impact of decisions and keeps objectives in mind throughout the process. Communicates the impact and implications of decisions. Completes the appropriate level of due diligence required to make a quick, accurate decision.


Drive for Results
 - Achieves results within established timelines. Understands and demonstrates that intentions, activities and results are not the same. Pursues everything with energy, drive, and a need to finish; does not give up before finishing, even in the face of resistance or setbacks; consistently challenges self and others for results.


Leadership
 - The expectation of leadership is not reserved solely for only those who are in positions of authority, but from all employees. They demonstrate high integrity and are motivated by wanting to make a real difference to people by delivering a high quality service for their customer and the organization. In positions of authority they: invest in development for the right people and identify and develop future leaders, and coach and provide candid feedback to others. They are visible and they model behaviours, competencies and values expected and inspire others to undertake challenging tasks and projects.


Teamwork 
- Is an effective team player who adds complementary skills and contributes valuable ideas, opinions and feedback. Communicates in an open and candid manner and can be counted upon to fulfill any commitments made to others on the team. Ensures the right stakeholders are informed and involved where necessary. Is ready to “roll up their sleeves” as necessary.


Think and Act like an owner
 - Thinks and cares about the organization like an owner. Commits to and upholds organizational values, and core behaviours even under difficult circumstances. Demonstrates a strong sense of responsibility and dedication to the success of the organization. Takes appropriate risks, holds self and others accountable for measurable, high-quality, timely, and cost-effective results and openly raises a challenge even if others don’t.

industries: Leasing Non-residential Real Estate, Financial Services, and Leasing Real Estate
description:
Who We Are

Centurion Asset Management Inc. is a recognized leader in the Investment and Property Management industries. Providing quality investments and housing for all its clients, our experienced team comprised of more than 280 Employees is a core component of Centurion’s success since 2003. Centurion Apartment Real Estate Investment Trust (“REIT”) owns more than 11,000 multi-family apartment units and student housing beds across 28 cities in Canada and the United States. Since day one, our goal has been to provide Residents and their families with clean, safe, and comfortable homes. The REIT provides investors an opportunity to invest in a diversified portfolio of rental apartments and student housing properties, as well as mortgage and equity investments in property developments, across Canada and the United States and participate in the profits derived from them. Centurion Financial Trust (“CFiT”) is an income and growth-oriented trust that invests in a diversified portfolio of debt investments that include but are not limited to mortgages, opportunistic real estate developments, and corporate debt. Investors pool their funds to invest in mortgage and growth-oriented credit opportunities and participate in the yields from interest income and net profit from equity.

Our Mission

Our mission is to be sought after as a leading-edge, reputable, multi-disciplinary alternative asset manager; to capitalize on opportunities in new and interesting investment strategies that meet our mission to Investors; and to embrace change, experimentation, innovation and learning from failure to make continual improvements that drive our success and keep us ahead of our competitors.

Our Values

Our core values can be summarized by the acronym RISE: Respect for our Investors, our Residents, Co-workers, Partners and Communities; Integrity in everything we do, demonstrating sincerity, honesty and the will to do it right; Simplicity free of pretension and hassle, full of value and common sense; and Excellence in offering all our Clients and Partners exceptional products and services quality, as well as providing our Employees with an excellent workplace.

Why Employees Want to Work with Us

We provide an inclusive environment where all employees are valued and supported. Over the years, we developed a work culture where the potential of every employee is maximized, and everyone has equal opportunities for growth. For certain roles, we offer numerous employee perks, including: Competitive Total Rewards Packages; Comprehensive Benefits Plan including Medical, Dental, and Vision Care; Flexible Work Week Schedules; Vacation Policy based on Length of Service; Summer and Holiday Hours Programs; Centurion Learning Academy; Opportunities for Growth; Education Reimbursement Policy; Mentoring Program; Employee Referral Program; Ergonomic Workstations Equipped with Standing Desks; Discounted Gym Membership; Company-wide Internal Communication Platforms; Employee Volunteer Opportunities; Quarterly Townhall Meetings and Social Gatherings; Employee Innovation Program; and Corporate Discount Card.



Overview



The Assistant General Manager is responsible for the professional management, administration and leasing for a portfolio of student housing communities for Centurion Property Associates Inc. │The MARQ.

The Assistant General Manager is accountable for management of all related resources, contracts, tools and supplies to ensure Centurion Asset Management Inc. | Centurion Property Associates Inc. real property assets are effectively and efficiently managed to established standards and within assigned budgets.



Responsibilities




Relationship Development


Develop and foster positive relationships with internal and external stakeholders. Ensure proactive timely resolution of staff, Contractor, Vendor, and Consultant performance issues.


Customer Service


Professionally and courteously handle all Resident inquiries, feedback, complaints or concerns, and escalate any issues to the General Manager. Ensure a high level of Resident satisfaction is achieved through constant and consistent attention to Centurion’s Vision, Mission and Values. Promote a strong sense of community.


Ongoing Operations


Operate properties consistent with the expectations of the management contract and approved annual budgets. Be responsible for ensuring all Centurion Property Associates’ policies and procedures are adhered to; constantly motivate and develop site staff, managing performance to established standards. Authorize Work Orders and Purchase Orders to approved limits, being cognizant of year-to-date expenditure and approved annual budgets. Review and approve invoices according to standard policies and procedures. Review and approve new leases according to established approval criteria. Ensure the timely collection of rent; initiate follow-up where payments are not made and initiate and attend to legal and collection as required. Continually review and evaluate the market rates for each property, ensuring revenues are optimized in the competitive environment. Complete regular site inspections of properties including vacant apartments, building common areas and plant operations to identify opportunities, and report any concerns or deficiencies promptly to Property and Asset Management. Review apartments at turnover and prepare a scope of work consistent with established standards. Ensure preventative maintenance is scheduled and completed. Monitor service contract performance. Ensure compliance with all legislation, including but not limited to: the Residential Tenancies Act, Labour Relations Act, Fire Code and Occupational Health and Safety Act.


Administration and Reporting


Assist in completing the required operating and financial reporting including detailed monthly property reports and variance analysis. Ensure all general emails are responded to daily. Complete weekly availability and traffic reporting as required. Develop and remit quarterly re-forecasts and annual budgets according to established timelines; assist the Director of Technical Services with preparation of capital budgets including the development of five year capital plans for each site. Maintain an orderly office area, including proper filing of all hard and soft copy documentation and correspondence. Assist with any Asset Management analysis and reporting as required. Complete any other reporting consistent with requirements of the property management contract. Complete other duties as assigned.


Sales and Marketing


Assist with the development and implementation of sales and marketing initiatives. Identify a variety of lead generation tactics to increase The MARQ product recognition in the student rental space. Maintain a constant awareness of the competitive environment for similar products, conducting further research where required to obtain a full understanding of competitive market positioning.


Risk Management


Ensure ongoing compliance with current codes, technical safety standards and legislation. Assist with effective and prompt resolution of municipal and provincial work orders. In cooperation with insurance entities, assist with the completion of quarterly or annual risk assessments, incorporate into capital or operations planning and implement as required to mitigate risk.



Requirements




A passion for excellence in customer service delivery;

Minimum 2 years’ property management experience is required; Student operations experience considered an asset;

A minimum of 2-3 years Managerial experience;

Exceptional written and oral communication skills;

Excellent organizational skills with a strong ability to multi-task;

Strong interpersonal skills;

Strong command of MS Office products: Word, Excel, PowerPoint;

Detail-oriented; able to resolve problems using facts, sound reasoning and common sense;

Forward thinking with an ability to develop creative strategic solutions to issues;

Strong follow-up skills with the ability to effectively resolve difficult issues in a timely manner; and

Experience with Yardi property management systems considered an asset. 


We thank all applicants for their interest in Centurion however, due to the volume of applicants we receive, only those selected for interview will be contacted.

Centurion is an inclusive and equal opportunity Employer committed to creating a positive, supportive and inclusive environment for all Employees. In accordance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act, 2005 (AODA), the Ontario Human Rights Code and all other applicable provincial rules and regulations, Centurion will provide accommodations throughout the recruitment and selection process to applicants with disabilities, as requested.

job_title: Workday HCM Senior Principal Consultant/Functional Architect
industries: IT Services and IT Consulting, Software Development, and Business Consulting and Services
description:
The HCM Sr. Principal Consultant/Functional Architect is the “go to” implementation leader, expected to provide expert guidance and delivery for HCM engagements. This individual serves as the billable functional leader on Workday HCM implementations. This person is a senior Workday HCM product expert who works closely with Engagement Managers, Managers, HCM functional area leads and senior customer resources. This person will provide overarching strategic guidance and leadership on HCM engagements to ensure a robust and complete solution that meets customer needs and allows for future enhancements with limited rework.


Responsibilities



 Solution Delivery 



 Provide functional leadership on multiple, concurrent Workday HCM implementations 

 Oversee HCM Architect Workshops and Customer Confirmation Sessions on Workday Implementations 

 Oversee all HCM functional areas (Core HCM, Core and Advanced Compensation, Benefits, Talent, Performance, Recruiting and Learning) on assigned implementations, ensuring efficient and accurate design and configuration of the delivered solution 

 Utilize CynergyTM methodology to deliver Workday HCM implementations 

 Continuous commitment to the ongoing optimization of the CynergyTM methodology, which includes driving team members to keep these tools current 

 Ensures cohesive structures and project communications are in place for cross-functional delivery between HCM and the following areas: Absence, Time Tracking, Payroll, Integrations, Financials, Organizational Change & Training, Data Conversion, and Reporting 




 Team Leadership 



 Partner with Engagement Manager (EM) and Portfolio Director (PD) 

 Act as a sounding board and provide ad-hoc advice for EM and leads 

 Serve as an advocate and escalation point for the EM and HCM functional team and ensure issues are being addressed 

 Help team to understand and adhere to methodology, and provide feedback to appropriate parties internally to support continuous enhancement of our tools and process 

 Mentor junior project resources by providing guidance allowing them to learn new skills and functional areas, lead customer sessions, and configure the solution 

 Drive team and individuals to achieve high customer satisfaction levels 

 Provide feedback to managers to facilitate practice growth and development for project team members 

 Ensure that issues and risks are being discussed openly with the appropriate people 

 Conduct internal QA process 




 Workday Knowledge 



 Certified in at least two sub-specialties in addition to HCM. Must be able to lead in each of these areas. Sub-specialties must include one of following: Core Compensation, Benefits or Recruiting 

 Attend regular Workday KSS calls for HCM product areas 

 Maintain Workday certifications through the biannual update process 




 Sales Support 



 Assist Solution Architects with estimating projects, as necessary 

 Participate in Sales Orals meetings for proposed assignments 

 Assist with or review estimates for Change Orders in HCM functional areas 

 Participate in discussion regarding HCM areas that may come into scope for project or customer 




Skills & Requirements



 Possess 4+ years of Workday implementation experience 

 Required characteristics: fast learner, detail oriented, decisive, and enjoy fast paced work environments 

 Must work well within and across teams to get things accomplished 

 Possess Sales engagement experience estimating and presenting to prospects 

 Completion of at least three full Workday HCM implementations 

 Led at least 3 HCM implementations 

 Experience gathering requirements, designing, prototyping, testing and deploying solutions to meet customer requirements 

 Passion for exceptional customer service 

 Strong communication and presentation skills, with the ability to effectively manage customer expectations 

 Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience in Human Resources, Human Resources Management, HRIS or related field 

 Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Office Suite, particularly Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint 

 Ability to travel up to 50% 




Unless expressly indicated, this role is not open in the State of Colorado or within New York City.



Why Choose Collaborative? 



Unlimited paid time off, including volunteer hours, balance days, flexible work schedules, and options to work remotely or out of one of 5 office locations to cultivate personal and professional balance

 Competitive benefits including 401(k) matching program , Medical, Dental, Life, and Vison insurance, and perk benefits such as commuter plans and pet insurance

Inclusive benefits that support mental health, gender affirmation journeys, caregiving and all paths to parenthood including Carrot Fertility, excellent paid parental leave programs for maternity, paternity, adoption, and surrogacy

Established Employee Resources Groups (ERG’s) that provide a safe space for employees to build relationships, connect, and develop initiatives to enhance diversity and inclusion 

Open, transparent lines of communication with leadership through Town Halls, internal newsletters, and monthly small group conversations with a member of the executive team

Committed to giving back to improve our communities and environmental impact

Opportunities for learning and development through established corporate programs, on and off-site trainings, and on-demand online learning courses

A people development focused environment where you have autonomy to drive your career path





Collaborative’s Travel Approach




Throughout the pandemic, Collaborative continued to achieve the highest level of customer satisfaction in the ecosystem as we worked with our clients to successfully deliver projects remotely

Because the future is still unknown, some clients will continue to be deployed remotely, while others may desire more face-to face-contact

We will monitor and adapt as needed, but we do not anticipate travel of more than 50%; many consultants will likely travel less than 25%

As Balance is a core value at Collaborative, we strive to ensure that Collabies find the right balance in their personal and professional lives, and that includes travel




Who You Are



 You have a Growth Mindset: A belief that abilities can be developed along with a desire to be curious, learn & grow 

 You take Initiative: Solve problems by thinking & taking action on solutions rather than waiting for direction 

 You take Accountability: Follow through on commitments, take ownership & ensure timeliness 

 You Give Back: Leverage your knowledge & expertise to make improvements around you 

 You are Resilient: Work through challenges with optimism, agility & adaptability 

 You demonstrate Awareness: An ability to understand how your attitudes & actions impact others and adapt your approach accordingly 





Collaborative Solutions Covid-19 Vaccine Policy




Collaborative Solutions has implemented an Interim Covid-19 vaccine policy that requires employees who are required or choose to be at an office or participate at in-person sales events, or in-person meetings/events to be fully vaccinated. At this time, our vaccination policy applies to roles where job duties can only be performed from an office location or require onsite presence as determined by the employee’s manager or client. Anyone unable to be fully vaccinated, either because of a sincerely held religious belief or a medical condition or disability that prevents them from being fully vaccinated, can request a reasonable accommodation.

job_title: Garden Department Supervisor : Full Time (6 Month Contract)
description:

Under the management of Department Supervisors, our Associates can flourish and reach their peak. Health and Dental Benefits for Full Time associates

The Home Depot Values that inspire team work and comradery amongst department leaders and associates

description:
The AGM is an important role within the operations of The Donnelly Group. A successful AGM will not only have a passion for products and service but also be a team leader and have an overall passion for the hospitality industry. It is a learning roll meant to develop into a venue General Manager role. The Bar Manager will report directly to the General Manager at each venue and the Donnelly Group Beverage Director.

Main responsibilities


Weekly front of house (FOH) ordering for liquor, wine, beer

Ensuring all orders were received & checked-off

On-going inventory management to ensure accurate par levels

Invoice tracking




Additional Duties




Track inventory effectively to reduce product loss & waste

Attend weekly Management operations meeting as necessary

Conduct weekly inventory & period end counts and enter into Bevspot

Assist in writing the weekly bar schedule with the GM

Create product-driven initiatives to build sales

Ensure world-class customer service from all bar staff

Champion the cocktail list with proper pouring and perfect recipe use

Ensure cleaning duties and checklists are completed daily

Recruitment and training of bar team

35% off at Bomber Brewing
