job_title: Patient Services Manager - Quinte 6 Medicine - Full-time - Belleville General Hospital
description:
Company Bio

Quinte Health Care (QHC) is a progressive and integrated system of four hospitals working with partners to provide exceptional care to their local communities.

Care is provided through four hospitals – Belleville General Hospital, North Hastings Hospital, Prince Edward County Memorial Hospital, and Trenton Memorial Hospital – and includes four emergency departments, operating rooms at three hospitals, a rehabilitation day hospital, children’s treatment centre, ambulatory care clinics, community mental health programs, and a range of diagnostic services. There are inpatient beds for acute medical patients, intensive care, obstetrics, paediatrics, mental health, complex continuing care, rehabilitation, and surgery.

With fantastic restaurants, a thriving arts and culture scene, and more than 40 wineries, the Quinte region is an excellent place to live. The array of parks, picturesque beaches, golf courses, and waterfront trails, provide plenty of opportunity for outdoor adventure. This dynamic, growing community offers affordable housing in both urban and rural settings and is an easy commute to larger centres such as Toronto, Kingston, Ottawa and Montreal. Visit www.bayofquinte.ca to learn more about the region.

Position Summary

The Patient Services Manager is a Regulated Health Professional who maintains responsibility for all aspects of patient care activities for an assigned corporate patient care service(s). The Patient Services Manager provides clinical & managerial leadership, direction and supports the interdisciplinary team members in the provision of optimum quality care to patients and their families/significant others.

This role promotes and facilitates evidence-based care across the care continuum to ensure a positive outcome for patients under the general direction of the Patient Services Director. This will be accomplished through the implementation and use of quality improvement, utilization management, risk management, and Health Quality Ontario standards, staff development and resource management strategies. The Patient Services Manager models and inspires the QHC corporate values and encourages the team to set unit goals that align with these values and strategic directions.

The Patient Services Manager is responsible for Quinte 6 – Medicine Unit.



Required



Required


Valid registration with a Professional Healthcare Regulating Body,

Recent acute care hospital clinical experience within the last five years,

Completed Baccalaureate Degree, commitment to pursuing a Masters degree or actively pursuing

A minimum of 5 years of clinical experience in acute care with strong experience a community based hospital,

A minimum of 3-5 years’ recent management/leadership experience in an acute care setting,

Understanding of acute care of the elderly and Gerontological practice standards preferred,

Proven leadership/management skills including strong human resources, labor relations, quality management, change management and utilization management skills,

Exceptional analytical and information-seeking skills that contribute to effective decision-making and strategic planning and execution of action plans that deliver results and motivate individuals for greater performance excellence

Ability to work with a diverse stakeholder group with demonstrated facilitating and coaching clinical areas on change initiatives Self-directed, courageous, and highly motivated with excellent interpersonal and communication skills

Experience managing competing demands in a fast-paced, multi-site, multi-disciplinary health care environment

Proven risk management strategies

Ability to respond to a large number of simultaneous/competing demands from patients, families, staff, physicians, and other programs and departments

Strong computer skills - efficient operation of Microsoft Word Software (Excel, Word, Power Point)

Evidence of effective communication and conflict resolution skills with the ability to develop positive working relationships with all stakeholders promoting collective problem solving approaches,

Demonstrated commitment to interprofessional practice standards,

Excellent interpersonal skills with a strong orientation to staff development and staff empowerment,




Preferred




Health Care Management/Leadership certification or equivalent program, and

Strong computer skills - efficient operation of Microsoft Word Software (Excel, Word, Power Point). 


Duties



Summary Of Duties, But Not Limited To




Directs team members in the implementation of Standards of Practice and ensures that appropriate standards are met which leads to positive patient outcomes,

Provides leadership to the patient care team to ensure patient/family focused care within a coordinated integrated care planning model of care delivery through the development of integrated care maps based on practice guidelines,

Acts as a resource to the team through clinical expertise and knowledge base related to the medical/clinical needs of patients. Incorporates nursing theories and research based practice to support clinical decision making. Assists in day to day problem solving within and across the services,

Works with community partners to ensure the provision of timely care to meet the needs of the patient.


Assists the team to manage risks, incidents, family/client complaints and discharge planning,


Assists the team to develop, maintain and assume overall responsibility for continuous quality improvement, utilization management and risk management activities, including implementation of standards and tracking mechanisms,

Provides guidance and direction in the discharge planning process and with the Team Leader of the service, provides support to the team,

As a member of the service team, assists with the organization, planning and implementation activities of the service team,

Promotes and maintains good interdepartmental relationships,

Develops the master schedule for each area of the service in conjunction with the staff within the service,

Supports and participates in the upgrading, implementation and maintenance of an integrated computerized hospital information system,

Selects, hires, promotes, transfers, disciplines, terminates and manages the labour relations and payroll function for all staff members within the service,

Assists the service team in using the performance appraisal program in order to evaluate and improve the performance of staff members and outcomes for client,

Supports the professional development of staff including the provision of educational programs and participation in continuing education sessions,

Determines the orientation needs of staff and coordinates the orientation program I conjunction with the service team,

Ensures appropriate work schedules are developed and maintained,

Maintains a presence wherever the services are provided across the corporation,

Provides overall delegation of and support to, student programs assigned to the area and enlists the participation of staff in student preceptorship programs,

Carries out all other patient care related duties as delegated,

Works collaboratively with other Patient Services Managers and provides coverage (performs the duties) for those Managers as required,


Financial Accountability


Determines the appropriate resource requirements to meet the needs of the service through appropriate benchmarking & utilization management.

Participates with the Director to develop corresponding operating and capital budgets.

Monitors resource utilization and financial performance 


Closing Statement

Quinte Health Care is an equal opportunity employer. We thank all interested candidates for their response, however, only those chosen for an interview will be contacted.

Equal Opportunity

Quinte Health Care is an equal opportunity employer committed to meeting needs under the Canadian Charter of Rights and Freedom and the Ontario Human Rights Code. Our Recruitment process follows the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act in order to provide a fair and equitable process for all candidates. Applicants requiring accommodation through the recruitment/interview process are encouraged to contact the Human Resources Department at ******** x2577 for assistance.

industries: Construction, Financial Services, and Leasing Real Estate
description:
The Strategic Insights and Risk Team (SI&R) is part of CF’s Finance Group, and is an innovative corporate strategy group composed of 3 key areas:


Strategic Planning & Risk (SP&R) includes strategic plan development, monitoring and related insights, oversight for Corporate Responsibility (CR), and Enterprise Risk Management (ERM)

Strategic Initiatives (SI) includes development of portfolio and asset class strategies and tactics to support decision-making and enable strategic execution

Research & Insights (R&I) conducts proprietary research and analysis to support decision-making across domestic & international markets, leveraging customers and tenant insights, as well as internal and external demographic, traffic and sales data




Role impact:


Become part of a highly focused and “best in class” group, providing strategic advice to Cadillac Fairview’s senior management team regarding its industry leading portfolio of retail and office assets. This role collaborates with various internal departments including, leasing, operations, research, and development to create and support execution of strategic initiatives and/or planning.

The Analyst, Strategic Planning will report to the Manager of Strategic Planning supporting research and driving analysis in support of strategic planning, corporate responsibility, and trends evaluation across all CF’s current and planned asset classes, current and future industry opportunities, and product or service offerings. This role will also support the research, analysis, and insights that facilitate the delivery of CF’s strategic plan, evolution of the Corporate Responsibility program, and other trends or benchmarking research (e.g. industry peer/best practice assessments, asset class reviews, business environment assessment, etc.) as they apply to evaluating CF business across asset classes, geographies, and innovation concepts

Relevant trends research may include proactive proposal and delivery as well as those requested by the executive team and senior management, including insights on growth opportunities, evolving asset type-specific trends, trends in corporate and social responsibility, new innovation concepts, and business model impacts from industry changes and new trends


What you will deliver: 



Participate in research and analysis to satisfy project deliverables. This includes establishing work plans, monitoring progress against goals, and conducting status updates to adjust approaches as required. 

Develop and manage financial models as they relate to scenario analysis and business model impacts. Provide reliable and timely interpretation that is synthesized for various levels of decision makers, including senior management and the executive

Prepare and present memoranda and presentations for senior management

Assist in organizing and facilitating discussions / brainstorming sessions with Cadillac Fairview’s leadership team to identify and align on strategic priorities

Periodically assist other departments including leasing, operations and development on special projects or other strategic analysis

Stay current on, and share as appropriate, new industry trends or disrupters in commercial real estate across all asset classes and geographies, including technology advances, changes impacting these industries and markets, and evolving corporate responsibility trends in the industry and among peers.




 What your strengths are: 



Solid interpersonal skills and proven track record of influencing, excellent verbal and written communication, naturally curious and confident

Strong critical thinking and problem solving skills

Superior analytical and quantitative skills

The ability to analyze and interpret large amounts of data and distill important concepts

The ability to clearly and concisely communicate complex information to a wide audience 

Strong interpersonal, verbal and written communication 

Strong organizational and prioritization skills; ability to work independently, multi-task and manage priorities in a demanding and continually changing fast-paced environment, often with multiple or competing deadlines

The ability to thrive in a team environment inspiring collaboration and thoughtful debate

A motivated self-starter attitude with a strong work ethic and a high level of attention to detail




What you need to succeed: 



An undergraduate or post-graduate degree in Commerce, Finance, Economics, or Real Estate

A minimum 2-4 years of work experience in a multi-sector real estate, private equity, consulting, or investment banking firm in an investment, valuation, internal consulting, strategy and/or asset management capacity

Analytical/quantitative/financial modeling skills in Microsoft Excel, Snowflake, Tableau; effective presentation creation skills in PowerPoint; ARGUS Valuation DCF software skills considered an asset

Demonstrated experience in data visualization and graphical presentation of quantitative data

Possession of (or working towards) a CFA / MBA or other professional designation considered an asset

Experience in commercial real estate (across different assets, including retail, office, multifamily, mixed use) and/or retail industry experience is an asset

Experience working in Corporate Responsibility and Strategy Planning are essential





Why you should join us:



At Cadillac Fairview we have been transforming communities for over 50 years. We are so much more than our properties. We are building leaders at all levels. We offer the challenge of interesting work, a great organizational culture, the opportunity to collaborate with the best in the business, and support for your growth and development. We reward values-based behavior and superior results with a competitive rewards package that includes best-in-class benefits and pension. Imagine a place where you can make a difference!

At CF our everyday actions and critical business decisions are guided by our CF Values. Achieving results is naturally important for us and we achieve results through behaviours that are consistent with our CF Values.


Are you someone who believes in our values?



 Aim Higher – we strive to exceed expectations 

 Own Your Expertise – we empower ourselves and each other 

 Collaborate Effectively – we bring the right people together to get the right results 

 Engage with Empathy – we objectively consider the needs of others 

 Embrace Change – we drive, learn from, and adapt to change 



At CF you’ll join a diverse community and award-winning team where your talent and commitment to excellence are welcomed, valued and respected. 
We’re ready to meet you there – are you?



CF is
 an equal opportunity employer
 and is committed to creating a diverse and inclusive environment. If you need reasonable accommodation during the recruitment, assessment, and/or selection process, please notify your CF contact or email cfcareers@cadillacfairview.com.



 In accepting this offer as a condition of employment, you acknowledge full receipt of the COVID-19 vaccination approved by Health Canada and will provide proof to cfhumanresrouces@cadillacfairview.com when you return your signed offer letter. A copy will not be retained.

industries: IT Services and IT Consulting, Software Development, and Financial Services
description:
Who We Are 


Provenir is a global fintech company with offices across North America, the UK, and Singapore. Provenir helps fintechs, financial institutions, and payment providers make smarter decisions, faster. We are passionate about technology and empowering businesses to become industry leaders. As a leading provider of decisioning and analytics products for financial services and other industries, we empower businesses to create digital-first decisioning solutions that drive business growth. If you’d like to work at an innovative fintech with a global footprint that is redefining the industry, then we want you!




Provenir is looking for a highly motivated, sales-focused field marketing leader to support our North America Sales Team. The Head of Field Marketing position is responsible for building compelling experiences across the customer journey. 
 The qualified candidate should be located in North America and will be able to work remotely.






What You'll Do


As the Field Marketing Manager, you have a strong understanding of building and managing pipeline to exceed growth targets. You enjoy partnering with regional leadership to understand the needs of the sales teams, and meeting those needs through effective partnership, strategy, and execution. This person should be in the region and have the ability to telecommute. You will drive a strong partnership with key internal stakeholders: Marketing, Sales, Customer Success as well as key external stakeholders. The ideal candidate will have a unique blend of leadership, agility, and communication skills.





Analyze lead flow and contribution to revenue, and evaluate ROI against all Field Marketing Programs

Meet or exceed targets for each regional sales leader

Establish account-based marketing programs and measure performance against target markets/accounts

Implement strategic partner marketing programs for delivery on revenue and logo targets

Secure customer advocates, references and case studies to support growth in the region

Drive pipeline growth by developing a GTM strategy and supporting budget covering the priority markets

Plan and execute global marketing campaigns

Partner with sales leadership on territory planning

Identify supporting content needs to deliver on campaign expectations

Define field marketing growth plan across North America

Be an advocate for the sales team and help the rest of the marketing department understand their priorities.

Be an advocate for the marketing team and help the sales team understand the marketing team’s priorities.

Own the corporate brand in region and use a mix of data sources to align your plan with the overall business objectives including new logos, pipeline generation and revenue targets.

As we scale the business, you will lead through influence a cross-functional team of marketers to build integrated marketing campaigns that put the customer first and use data to optimize the marketing mix across events, digital, thought leadership and demand generation.






Qualifications and Skills



3+ years of B2B technology marketing

5+ years of field marketing

Creative thinker who looks to move beyond the status quo

Proven ability to grow market share in the technology sector

Experience across many functions of marketing is a plus

Team player attitude and willingness to take on special projects





Our employees are our top priority, we offer comprehensive health and wellness plans. You will enjoy paid time off and company holidays, flexible and remote-friendly opportunities.





At Provenir, we recognize that diversity and inclusion make our teams stronger. We are committed to equal employment opportunity and welcome everyone regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, national origin, age, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, marital status, domestic partner status, citizenship, or veteran status or medical condition. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply.

industries: Food and Beverage Services and Hospitality

description:
8150 Parkhill Drive

Milton, Ontario, L9T5V7

Canada


Do you want to work for a Global Company that supplies some of the World's Largest brand name customers? We are an innovative packaging solutions provider and are looking for a Production Manager to join our Milton team.




Opportunity Summary



Our Milton, Ontario Corrugated Plant is hiring a Production Manager. The Production Manager is responsible for the day-to-day activities of maintaining the plant facility operations, including safety policies, personnel, housekeeping, maintenance, production activities, customer requirements, planning and scheduling. The PM will serve as a member of the management leadership team and must contribute to achieving sales objectives. The Production Manager will also serve as a coach to team members and assist in the development and evaluation of direct reports.



How You Will Impact WestRock




 Provide leadership and guidance on the coordination of the 24/7 plant activities through planning with Superintendents to ensure the manufacturing objectives are accomplished in a timely and cost-effective manner

 Review customer requirements and specifications to identify improvement opportunities and implement solutions to increase customer satisfaction

 Coordinate and maintain ongoing, effective, safety plans to ensure program adoption and implementation

 Offer new ideas to support fulfillment of department goals and procedures for continuous improvement, retention of customer base, company profitability, and employee job satisfaction

 Develop and manage defined communication channels across various stakeholder groups to build effective relationships and produce superior products

 Manage P&L, capital expenditures, manufacturing costs and operating efficiencies to improve plant profitability

 Monitor and control waste management to manage production costs and reduce environmental impacts




What You Need To Succeed




 High School diploma or G.E.D.

 7 to 10 years of experience in manufacturing industry

 7 plus years of related leadership experience in a production facility

 Demonstrated mechanical acumen

 Proven experience using scheduling software

 Ability to work in fast paced JIT (just-in-time) manufacturing environment

 Demonstrated expertise in process management to ensure production efficiency

 Relentless determination and courage to make things happen; strong execution skills; results-oriented

 Ability to respond quickly to changing demands, processes, and updated information

 Demonstrated understanding of quality processes and continuous improvement, such as Six Sigma certification

 Excellent communication skills and ability to interact across all levels of the organization, while accomplish organizational goals

 Demonstrated knowledge of capital management (P&L and capital budgets) and analyzing financial data

 Established courses of action for self and/or others to accomplish specific planning goals




Why Work For WestRock




 Competitive Salary and bonus plan

 Comprehensive Benefits Plan from the first day of hire

 Company matched DC Pension Plan from the first day of hire

 Employee Stock Purchase Plan

 A Company focused on continuous learning with Tuition Reimbursement Plan

A career with a global packaging company where Sustainability, Safety, and Inclusion are business drivers and foundational elements of the daily work.

A management team committed to WestRock's values of Respect, Accountability, Integrity and Excellence


As part of our commitment to accessibility for all persons with disabilities, WestRock will, upon request from the applicant, provide accommodation during the recruitment process to ensure equal access to applicants with disabilities. Please contact WestRock, Human Resources at (905)864-4003 about your needs and we will consult with you to ensure suitable accommodation is provided.

Apply to www.westrock.com/careers . ATR15196.

Are you passionate about everything marketing? Is digital marketing your specialty? Have you worked in B2B marketing before? 




We are looking for a bilingual marketing coordinator ready to assist the Marketing and Sales manager in executing marketing campaigns, researching new opportunities, and contributing creatively to the elaboration of marketing efforts. 




Our company, uxpertise, specializes in the development of solutions in education technology. You will be involved in the outreach and promotion of our uxpertise LMS and uxpertise XP solutions via the digital client experience. 




Join uxpertise, a talented, creative and passionate team! Benefit from our employee perks such as remote work, health insurance, physical activity allowance, fun team activities, and more. 





Main responsibilities:
 

Under the responsibility of the Marketing and Sales Manager you will have the following responsibilities: 


Monitor and optimize SEM campaigns. Provide performance reports and recommendations. (Google Ads, LinkedIn Ads) 

Create, send, and review newsletter campaigns to our subscribers  

Send client communications concerning updates and new features 

Maintain promotional marketing materials (brochures, presentations, etc.) 

Review and provide feedback on blogs, articles and social posts provided by our copywriter 

Publish blogs on the website (Wordpress) 

Publish social media posts (LinkedIn, Facebook, Instagram) 

Actively participate in group discussions on LinkedIn 

Monitor uxpertise presence on the internet and social media 

Analyze behavior on various analytics tools and prepare reports (Google Analytics, Hotjar, etc.) 

Maintain client documentation (user guides, video tutorials) 

Coordinate with graphic designer to obtain necessary graphics for the website, social media, marketing campaigns, and client requests 

Assist clients in the implementation of their platform (branding) 

Research and stay up to date on competitor activities. Provide market trends, forecast and recommendations. 

Identify marketing opportunities to increase brand notoriety and sales.  

Contribute to marketing and creative brainstorm initiatives 


 


Requirements and skills sought :
 


Hold a bachelor's degree in business with a concentration in marketing, or relevant related experience. 

Have at least 1 year of marketing experience (a digital marketing experience is a great asset); 

Be perfectly bilingual (French, English) orally and in writing. Spanish is an asset. 

Priority management and ability to manage multiple projects at once; 

Spirit of analysis and synthesis 

Strong communication skills (oral and written) 

Proactivity and attention to detail, well organized, structured and rigorous; 

Computer knowledge and solid knowledge of the Microsoft Office suite, Google Ads, Google Analytics, CRM tool, marketing analytics tools; 

Knowledge of social media platforms, such as: LinkedIn, Facebook, Instagram 

Have an interest in using digital platforms and tools to maximize goals; 

Basic knowledge of Wordpress (an asset) 


 


Work conditions and advantages :
 

Work schedule: 40 hours/week, Monday to Friday, flexible schedule 

Expected start date: as soon as possible 

Workplace: 100% remote work. Eventually hybrid work conditions (part-time office, part-time remote) as health measures evolve. 

Advantage: 


Group insurance including dental 

Vacation based on experience 

Bonus holidays 

Team activities 

Summer Fridays (afternoon off) 

Physical activity allowance 


 


Only candidates retained for interviews will be contacted.
 

 


ABOUT UXPERTISE
 

Founded in 2016, uxpertise is a company that develops and offers solutions in education technology. 

The company mainly offers 2 solutions: 


UXPERTISE LMS: The seriously fun learning management system 


uxpertise LMS is a learning management platform that enables businesses, organisations, and training centres to manage their training activities online. The platform adapts to your needs. Businesses can use it for internal employee and partner training, and training centers can use it commercially to sell their training activities and products. 


UXPERTISE XP: Online exam auto-proctoring solution 


uxpertise XP is our online exam auto-proctoring solution. This solution ensures the test-taker’s integrity when taking exams remotely and online, and thus helps maintain the perceived value of your certifications.

Our expectations: 


The primary function of the Customer Service Associate (CSA) is to assist customers with all of their shopping needs. The CSA is required to respond to customer inquiries and support them throughout their shopping experience including promoting customer loyalty plans and/or extended protection/replacement plans where appropriate. Duties also include processing customer sales and returns by operating a cash register, handling internet and pickup orders, looking up merchandise information for price matches, and assisting other team members as needed. This position reports to an Assistant Store Manager and takes daily direction from a Department Manager. This position does not have direct reports.


Your role: 



Address customer complaints over the phone and in person

Maintain a safe and secure work environment by conducting daily safety reviews, noting hazards, keeping store areas clean and organized, and monitoring for potential theft or security risks

Complete all other duties as assigned




The qualifications we are looking for:



At least 6 months of experience using a computer, including inputting, accessing, modifying, or outputting information

At least 6 months of experience using a handheld device (e.g., mobile phone, LRT gun, palm pilot, tablet, iPod) to enter, access, and output information

Degree or diploma in Business, Retail, or Management, specialty related to department (e.g., design, appliances), or in a related field

At least 6 months of experience identifying and selling products based on customer needs, including credit cards, installations, add-on sales, and explaining warranties, product features, and benefits

At least 6 months of retail experience

At least 6 months of experience as a cashier

Ability to lift up to 25 pounds without assistance; may lift up to 30 pounds with or without assistance




Your benefits of working for Lowe’s Canada:



 An inclusive and safe working environment

 Promotion of work-life balance

 Exclusive employee discounts

 Benefits: insurance (certain conditions apply), annual salary review, etc.

 Opportunities for advancement within the company

 An employer that’s involved in the community

 Teamwork and ongoing training

 A comprehensive training program for all new hires

 A company discount on store merchandise

 A student incentive program

 And much more!



At Lowe’s Canada, over 26,000 employees let their passion blossom every day. Our teams from the Lowe’s, RONA, Réno-Dépôt, and Dick’s Lumber banners across Canada are driven by the desire to help people bring their projects to life and are committed to making a difference in the communities we serve.

So if you're looking to do what you love, and to grow and evolve within our family—one of the best employers in Canada according to a recent Forbes survey—we could be perfect for each other. You’ll find career opportunities that live up to your ambitions and be able to further develop your unique set of skills. You’ve got the talent? We’ve got the tools!

The masculine generic is used without discrimination and only in order to simplify the text. Lowe’s Canada is committed to encouraging diversity and inclusion. We are pleased to consider applications from all qualified candidates, regardless of race, colour, religion, sexual orientation, gender, nationality, age, disability, or any other status protected by law.

You support the leadership team to cultivate an environment that promotes authentic best-in-class employee and customer experiences and are guided by our culture and our mission of adding joy. Your role as a Customer Experience Manager is one of collaboration, innovation, inspiration, support, and coaching and in doing so; you help to sustain a high performing culture. You consistently role model the Indigo Beliefs and are a leader that sets examples for your team to follow. You share your passion for all things electronic with your team and customers.




WHAT YOU’LL DO





Support and empower a team of Customer Experience Representatives to make decisions, creating a highly engaged and high performing team.

Recruit and develop a high-performing team that is accountable for creating a best-in-class employee experience

Work with the General Manager/ Associate General Manager to develop internal talent; building a bench for future store needs.

Unlock full potential of employees by providing consistent feedback

Own self-development and provides continuous feedback to General Manager/Associate General Manager

Role model Indigo’s High Performance Characteristics

Represent Indigo as a brand ambassador, bringing to life Indigo’s mission of creating joy

Promote a Story Telling culture fulfilling our goal to enrich the lives of our customers

Own and champion Indigo’s customer loyalty and Love of Reading programs

Cultivate an environment of trust where the opinions, voices, and well-being of employees are valued, enabling people to bring their best selves to work

Inspire a customer-centric culture in stores bringing to life Indigo’s mission of creating joy and enriching lives

Foster an environment where everyone knows their health and safety is a top priority and where everyone actively participates in ensuring the health and safety of each other and our customers

Respond to customer feedback in a timely manner ensuring that the customer remains a top priority

Align with General Manager/Associate General Manager on goals and objectives for fiscal year

Ensures teams drive best-in-class employee engagement and net promoter scores

Consistently meet and exceed sales plans

Support the General Manager/Associate General Manager in effectively managing budgets and cost centres, driving positive Store Profitability

Actively engages in community-based marketing and events to grow sales and strengthen community ties

Launch and evaluate new programs and initiatives that impact business performance

Responsible for meeting Expense budgets including service stock, office supplies

Oversee scheduling requests and weekly schedule revisions (TEAM) and ensures all schedules are fully optimized to drive sales and productivity

Key Liaison and Leader for Loss Prevention and Health & Safety programs




Qualifications




WHO YOU ARE





2 + year of management or leadership experience with demonstrable skills and success in leading and developing others

Experience in retail or the services sector

Proven track record of achieving sales and performance targets 

Ability to be mobile on the sales floor for extended periods of time

Availability to work a flexible schedule, including evenings, weekends and holidays

Ability to lift medium to large items, up to 40 pounds, while using appropriate equipment and safety techniques

Passionate 

Curious

Humble

Giving

Driven

Bilingualism (French/English) is required for all positions in Québec




Additional Information



At Indigo, we are committed to our communities, our customers, and each other; together we can make a positive impact. We know that fostering diversity and inclusion brings out your full potential and creates a joyful and welcoming environment for everyone. We are driven to be an equitable employer, which highly values your diverse backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. We believe that you, in all your uniqueness, belong at Indigo. We welcome all applicants and encourage applications from individuals who identify as Black, Indigenous, a person of colour, LGBTQ2+ and people with disabilities. Accommodations are available upon request to individuals who self-identify as having a disability or special need. Please contact Human Resources at 1 (888) 881-3177 (toll free) or Support-HR@indigo.ca if you require an accommodation at any time during the recruitment process.

description:
What It’s All About



Fun, Friends, and Rewarding Work in a Breathtaking Setting!

Panoramic views of Victoria's nature and scenery are the backdrop to your new favorite place to work and play! Table Nineteen Restaurant at Olympic View Golf Club has an entrepreneurial, energetic, and professional team that loves meeting new people and providing an authentic Guest experience. We’re looking to add a motivated, charismatic, and friendly Food and Beverage Event Supervisor to our team! If this sounds like you, we’d love to hear from you.



What You'll Get To Do



Master new skills based on your own ambitions; we provide support for your personal and professional growth.

Oversee events from start to finish, as well as work in the Table Nineteen Restaurant.

Show your inspired upbeat attitude to foster teamwork.

What You Bring



1-2 years experience in a Food & Beverage and events role.

Exceptional communication and organizational skills.

Ability to think fast and react quickly with a calm mind.

Multi-tasking proficiency and an effortless ability to prioritize.

Integrity: Reflects with humble self-evaluation.

Competitive hourly wage

FREE GOLF and LESSONS

description:
The General Manager is responsible for overall Planning, Organizing, leading, and controlling (P-O-L-C) functions of the facility. In addition, the General Manager will manage all aspects of the P-O-L-C framework with the goal of leading the facility and staff to meet budget, revenue, and customer satisfaction standards. Through a thorough understanding of Copart policies and practices, the General Manager will create a customer first environment for internal and external customers by offering unique and innovative solutions that meet customer needs while maintaining company standards for policy, quality, and service.



Essential Duties




 Partners with HR to attract, recruit, develop and retain a diverse, high performing team

 Train and develop staff to meet company guidelines and expectations 

 Ensure there is continual, positive communication and feedback with staff in addition to all annual Continuous Improvement Summaries (CIS -- Reviews) delivered timely

 Manages team through an innovative, creative, inspirational leadership style

 Ability to hold staff consistently accountable with unbiased fairness to help drive performance

 Create a highly engaged team environment which drives execution, innovation, productivity, and future leaders

 Holds self to a high level of integrity in all interactions and decision making

 Proactively manages performance of managers and staff to address all opportunities quickly, and to redirect or take appropriate action if applicable

 Manages the day-to-day operations of the facility including, but not limited to becoming a Subject Matter Expert (SME) in all process areas both in the office and with outside yard jobs and tasks

 Responsible for recruiting and maintaining appropriate number of sub-haulers to manage the logistical requirements of running a Copart facility properly and effectively

 Must remain within allowable compliance guidelines for any System Quality Reviews, Field Quality Reviews, and Equipment and Safety Reviews

 Must immediately raise any concerns that could negatively impact the facility, the employees, or customers up to the Regional Manager

 Set goals and ensures that each employee is leveraging the tools provided to them to achieve continual success

 Ensure your locations are compliant with laws and regulations to include county, state, EPA, OSHA, and Department of Motor Vehicle regulations

 Disseminate pertinent knowledge throughout location to all employees to ensure transparency and clarity on company goals and initiatives

 Responsible for customer relationships (buyers, sellers, and internal customers)

 Identifying knowledge and skill gaps amongst your team and ensure there are remedies for said gaps

 Brand ambassador of the company's mission, vision, values, and culture

 Ability to communicate to all levels of leadership throughout the organization with tact and professionalism both written and verbal

 May be called upon to support local or non-local CAT events throughout the year

 Accountable for understanding the assigned profit and Loss Statement. Identifying ways to increase revenue and decrease costs.

 Other duties as assigned by Regional Manager or a member of upper Management


Le directeur général est responsable des fonctions globales de planification, d'organisation, de direction et de contrôle (P-O-L-C) de l'établissement. De plus, le directeur général gérera tous les aspects du cadre P-O-L-C dans le but de diriger l'installation et le personnel pour respecter les normes de budget, de revenus et de satisfaction de la clientèle. Grâce à une compréhension approfondie des politiques et pratiques de Copart, le directeur général créera un environnement axé sur le client pour les clients internes et externes en offrant des solutions uniques et innovantes qui répondent aux besoins des clients tout en maintenant les normes de l'entreprise en matière de politique, de qualité et de service.

TÂCHES ESSENTIELLES


S'associe aux RH pour attirer, recruter, développer et retenir une équipe diversifiée et performante

Former et développer le personnel pour répondre aux directives et aux attentes de l'entreprise

Veiller à ce qu'il y ait une communication et une rétroaction continues et positives avec le personnel en plus de tous les résumés annuels d'amélioration continue (CIS - Examens) livrés en temps opportun

Gère l'équipe grâce à un style de leadership innovant, créatif et inspirant

Capacité à tenir le personnel constamment responsable avec une équité impartiale pour aider à stimuler les performances

Créer un environnement d'équipe très engagé qui stimule l'exécution, l'innovation, la productivité et les futurs leaders

Se tient à un haut niveau d'intégrité dans toutes les interactions et la prise de décision

Gère de manière proactive les performances des superviseurs et du personnel pour répondre rapidement à toutes les opportunités et pour rediriger ou prendre les mesures appropriées, le cas échéant

Gère les opérations quotidiennes de l'installation, y compris, mais sans s'y limiter, devenir un expert en la matière (SME) dans tous les domaines de processus à la fois au bureau et avec des travaux et des tâches à l'extérieur de la cour

Responsable du recrutement et du maintien du nombre approprié de transporteurs pour gérer correctement et efficacement les exigences logistiques de la gestion d'une installation Copart

Doit respecter les directives de conformité autorisées pour les inspections la qualité du système, les inspections de la qualité dans les systèmes et les inspections de l'équipement et de la sécurité

Doit immédiatement soulever toute préoccupation qui pourrait avoir un impact négatif sur l'installation, les employés ou les clients jusqu'au directeur régional

Fixer des objectifs et s'assurer que chaque employé tire parti des outils qui lui sont fournis pour atteindre un succès continu

Assurez-vous que vos emplacements sont conformes aux lois et réglementations pour inclure les réglementations du comté, de la localité, de l'EPA, de l'OSHA et du Department of Motor Vehicle

Diffuser les connaissances pertinentes sur l'ensemble du site à tous les employés pour assurer la transparence et la clarté des objectifs et des initiatives de l'entreprise

Responsable des relations clients (acheteurs, vendeurs et clients internes)

Identifier les lacunes en matière de connaissances et de compétences au sein de votre équipe et s'assurer qu'il existe des solutions pour ces lacunes

Ambassadeur de marque de la mission, de la vision, des valeurs et de la culture de l'entreprise

Capacité à communiquer avec tous les niveaux de direction de l'organisation avec tact et professionnalisme, tant à l'écrit qu'à l'oral

Peut être appelé à soutenir des événements CAT locaux ou non locaux tout au long de l'année

Responsable de la compréhension du compte de profits et pertes assigné. Identifier les moyens d'augmenter les revenus et de réduire les coûts.

Autres tâches assignées par le directeur régional ou un membre de la haute direction

 Minimum of 2-3 years as a manager, military or other relevant experience preferred

 Proven track record of driving and achieving operational excellence and execution of corporate goals

 Metric Driven

 Proven track record on supporting change initiatives and ensuring the team can easily adapt to, and manage the change effectively and with positivity

 Strong communication skills with the ability to adjust your tone/communication style according to your audience

 Strong relationship building skills

 Strong critical thinking skills using logic and help to identify alternative solutions to operational issues

 Strong decision-making skills -- will consider benefits and risks to potential decisions to choose the most appropriate course of action

 Strong listening skills -- takes the time to actively listen to issues or concerns to help develop and execute on the solution

 Able to manage time effectively and prioritize tasks to meet new deadlines or productivity goals

 Strong problem-solving skills

 Able to multi-task and stay positive and motivated with a strong sense of urgency

 Bi-lingual a plus

 Travel may be required

 Valid Driver's License



For nearly four decades, Copart has led its industry in innovation and customer service, enabling it to grow profitably in markets across the globe. Our success is the direct result of the skills and efforts of our talented and diverse employees. Our mindset? It's never just a "job" when your coworkers are like family - it's like coming home.



 Minimum de 2-3 ans en tant que gestionnaire, militaire ou autre expérience pertinente

Expérience avérée en matière de conduite et d'atteinte de l'excellence opérationnelle et d'exécution des objectifs de l'entreprise

Axé sur les données

Expérience avérée en matière de soutien aux initiatives de changement et de garantie que l'équipe pourra facilement s'adapter et gérer le changement de manière efficace et positive

Solides compétences en communication avec la capacité d'ajuster votre ton/style de communication en fonction de votre public

Solides compétences en matière d'établissement de relations

Solides compétences en pensée critique utilisant la logique et aidant à identifier des solutions alternatives aux problèmes opérationnels

Solides compétences en matière de prise de décision - examinera les avantages et les risques des décisions potentielles pour choisir le plan d'action le plus approprié

Solides capacités d'écoute - prend le temps d'écouter activement les problèmes ou les préoccupations pour aider à développer et à mettre en œuvre la solution

Capable de gérer le temps efficacement et de prioriser les tâches pour respecter de nouveaux délais ou objectifs de productivité

Solides compétences en résolution de problèmes

Capable d'effectuer plusieurs tâches et de rester positif et motivé avec un fort sentiment d'urgence

Bilingue

Des déplacements peuvent être nécessaires

Permis de conduire valide



Depuis près de quatre décennies, Copart est à la tête de son industrie en matière d'innovation et de service client, lui permettant de croître de manière rentable sur les marchés du monde entier. Notre succès est le résultat direct des compétences et des efforts de nos employés talentueux et diversifiés. Notre état d'esprit ? Ce n'est jamais juste un "travail" quand vos collègues sont comme une famille - c'est comme rentrer à la maison.


Equal Opportunity Employer Minorities/Women/Protected Veterans/Disabled

What is the opportunity?

As an RBC Financial Advisor, you attract, nurture, and grow relationships with our high-value personal and small business clients by adding value in the moments that matter to them. You provide your clients with proactive, professional advice and collaborate with RBC partners to help clients with their goals and key life events. As an expert advisor, you contribute to strong sales and retention. Whether you are helping a client learn how to bank digitally, proposing an investment strategy to finance their child's education or recommending how to borrow for their "Someday", your expertise will contribute to creating meaningful and memorable client experiences.

What will you do?


 Communicate with clients to learn about their needs and help them achieve their goals

 Provide professional advice and education with an ability to address complex credit and investment needs, concerning both personal and business needs

 Collaborate with market-leading professionals in financial planning, retirement planning, mortgages, and business banking experts to ensure clients receive customized and targeted expert advice

 Leverage technology to deliver on client experience and drive sales and retention

 Proactively take ownership of resolving and preventing client's banking problems

 Implement contact and relationship building strategies, and support new client acquisition in local community

 Educate clients on the features and benefits RBC products and services offer, and help clients with digital, banking including mobile, ATM, and online banking


What do you need to succeed?

Must-have


 Valid Mutual Funds accreditation (Investment Funds in Canada or Canadian Securities Course)

 Completed Certificate in Financial Services Advice, offered through the CSI (i.e. Personal Financial Service Advice and Financial Planning I)

 2-3 years of proven sales experience in the financial services industry, handling credit and investments

 Demonstrated ability to build trust and maintain long-term client relationships

 Digital literacy across a broad range of devices (i.e., smartphones, tablets, laptops, etc.)


Nice-to-have


 Fluency in a second language

 Active in the local community, developing a solid network in the local community


What's in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.


 Career development and top-notch sales coaching to take your career to the next level

 Competitive salary, annual bonus, and recognition programs that reward top performance

 Strong suite of tools, including emerging digital capability to enhance your competitive edge

 Opportunity to represent Canada's leading financial services brand in your community


RBC is committed to supporting flexible work arrangements when and where available. Details to be discussed with Hiring Manager.

RBC requires as a condition of employment that all successful candidates in the United States and Canada be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 prior to their start date, and may require proof of the same. Reasonable accommodation is available where required by law.

Join our Talent Community

Stay in-the-know about great career opportunities at RBC. Sign up and get customized info on our latest jobs, career tips and Recruitment events that matter to you.

Expand your limits and create a new future together at RBC. Find out how we use our passion and drive to enhance the well-being of our clients and communities at jobs.rbc.com.



Job Summary



City: Sudbury

Address: 1879 Regent St South

Work Hours/Week: 37.5

Work Environment: Branch

Employment Type: Full Time

Career Level: Experienced Hire/Professional

Application Deadline: 03/14/2022

About Us





At How To Cake It, we provide our community of over 13+ million baking and sweets enthusiasts with everything they need to become better bakers. From leading 
educational resources 
such as online tutorials, interactive video courses and live workshops taught by world-class experts, to 
consumer goods 
such as cookbooks, baking tools, cookie decorating supplies, kitchenware, and other useful sweet-related merchandise that helps make baking more fun and memorable.




We have a passionate team of people working remotely around the world and at our production studio/headquarters in Toronto.








Summary





The Social Content Specialist is responsible for the strategy and management of all company owned social media platforms including Instagram, Tik Tok, Facebook, Pinterest and YouTube. This involves collaborating with the production team and third party artists on the execution of content, as well as liaising with the Marketing Operations Manager on company/brand marketing initiatives and expected targets. The Social Content Specialist will research content, user and respective platform trends, develop content strategies for the social platforms, and be hands on in the creation of content when necessary. They will be responsible for making sure the content is engaging, suited to its respective platform, and that it meets the sales objectives determined in collaboration with the Marketing Operations Manager. They will be required to reach the target audience and provide insight into how to improve processes and engagement with the targeted audience. In addition to managing the content creation they will manage the publishing process, and monitor platform analytics for the purpose of providing actional steps towards improvement.




The Social Content Specialist will also be responsible for collaborating with the Marketing Operations Manager, Email Marketing Manager and additional team members on content required for the blog, marketing emails and digital ads. This can include ensuring that content made for social is utilized on other content marketing platforms, as well as contributing to the execution of content needed here. The Social Content Specialist will not be responsible for managing these additional platforms entirely.




The ideal candidate should be an expert at using content to connect and build communities, educate and convert them to customers. Additionally, they should possess excellent knowledge of user and content trends. We are looking for a creative person who takes initiative, is able to build strategy and can set their own direction. The Social Content Specialist should also have strong organizational skills, be able to execute on content creation and be able to troubleshoot when encountered with issues.








Responsibilities





Social Media


Develop and create content strategies for all company owned social media platforms that successfully ladder up to company/brand marketing targets (may include sales, brand reach, etc) and reach the target audience

Design content calendar for all company owned social media platforms that ladders up to same, and ensure it is relevant to our community, best in class, customized to respective platform and engaging

Liaise with the Head of Production on content needs to determine scheduling, deadlines, and required talent necessary to execute

Liaise with production/design team members on output – provide clear briefs and direction for content, notes on video edits and copy, required formats and details. Provide final approval on all content that is posted.

Oversee Content Coordinator in scheduling, publishing and following best platform practices (hashtag strategy, copy format, etc)

Research platform functionality + updates, content and user trends to ensure success of all initiatives above

Track platform analytics, generating reports that provide actionable steps towards improving results that can be presented to the company

Liaise with Marketing Operations Manager, Email Marketing Manager and other responsible team members around strategies to leverage social media content on the website blog, in ads, and in email marketing. Plan content collaboratively for optimal efficiency and leverage









Qualifications



Bachelor's degree in literature, journalism, marketing, communications, or similar.

A minimum of three years of experience working specifically in the area of growth content marketing on social media

A portfolio of published work

Deep understanding of and experience with core platforms like Instagram and Tik Tok, reasonable understanding of platforms like Facebook, Youtube and Pinterest.

Manage copywriters and other freelancers to help bring the posts to life and ensure the content is best in class

Good knowledge of content and layout design tools such as Canva, Adobe InCopy and InDesign.

Good knowledge of project/task management tools like Asana

Excellent computer skills with Google Suite.

Excellent written and verbal communication skills.

Intellectually curious and a lifelong learner

The ability to keep abreast of content and consumer trends and advancements in technology

Previous experience working in production and/or content creation (ex. photography, video, in-app editing etc.)

Passion for food, baking and/or experience creating food related content










 
Working at How To Cake It





This is a remote, full-time permanent position. We value and invest in professional development, and as a high-growth company, offer significant opportunities to learn new skills, participate in new business initiatives, and grow your influence and role in the company over time.




We’re focused, driven, and passionate about our work – if you live and feel the same way, you’ll fit right in.




There is a tremendous opportunity for growth and success, as we continue to expand, and we can’t wait for you to be a part of it.





How to Cake it strives to build diverse teams that reflect the communities we work in, and encourages applications from traditionally underrepresented groups including women, visible minorities, Indigenous peoples, people identifying as LGBTQ+, veterans, and people with disabilities.

At Fairmont Waterfront our engaging service and delicious cuisine make every special event a truly memorable affair, both within our distinctive surroundings and off-site. Be an ambassador for our exceptional offerings as Event Services Manager, where you will liaise between multiple departments to meet the needs - and exceed the expectations - of your clients.



What Is In It For You




 Employee benefit card offering discounted rates in Accor worldwide

 Learning programs through our Academies

 Opportunity to develop your talent and grow within your property and across the world!

What You Will Be Doing




 Books function space for clients and co-ordinates and distributes applicable function details in a timely manner with attention to detail

 Builds creative menus and designs floor plans for events

 Handles requests from clients that are necessary to facilitate their function successfully, confirming electrical, internet, telecommunications, audio-visual and exhibition requirements based on discussions with clients

 Consistently offers professional, friendly and engaging service

 Prepares sales contracts, event orders and conference resumes

 Works with Sales to ensure proper coordination and distribution of applicable information concerning convention clients

 Attends and participates in related internal departmental meetings to ensure information is given and to assist in problem solving decisions

 Conducts daily walk throughs of the function areas to meet/greet clients and ensure their needs are being met

 Generates business via direct face-to-face sales calls, telephone, and written correspondence, including walk in inquires and site inspections

 Follows departmental policies and procedures

 Acts as a liaison between client and internal hotel personnel to ensure maximum guest satisfaction

 Be available as requested for special duties dictated by client's needs or those of the hotel

 Follow departmental policies and procedures including all safety policies

 Other duties as assigned




Your Experience And Skills Include




 Minimum 4 years Catering/Event Services or Sales experience

 Previous leadership experience with a similair role required

 Proven ability to build and maintain good relationships with all stakeholders

 Communicate thoughts, actions and opportunities clearly with strong networking skills

 Strong computer skills including Opera Sales & Catering, Property Manager, Social Table, Word, Excel, Passkey

 Front Office, Reservations and Banquets experience an asset

 University/College degree in a related discipline preferred

 Strong interpersonal and problem solving abilities

 Highly responsible and reliable

 Ability to focus attention on guest needs, remaining calm and courteous at all times


Visa Requirements: Must be legally eligible to work in Canada. The hotel is unable to assist candidates in obtaining Canadian work authorization.



Our Commitment To Diversity & Inclusion



We are an inclusive company and our ambition is to attract, recruit and promote diverse talent.

Why work for Accor?

We are far more than a worldwide leader. We welcome you as you are and you can find a job and brand that matches your personality. We support you to grow and learn every day, making sure that work brings purpose to your life, so that during your journey with us, you can continue to explore Accor's limitless possibilities.

By joining Accor, every chapter of your story is yours to write and together we can imagine tomorrow's hospitality. Discover the life that awaits you at Accor, visit https://careers.accor.com/

Do what you love, care for the world, dare to challenge the status quo! #BELIMITLESS
